Lusine is 39 years old and she is mother of three children; she has two daughters and a son. She lives in Varser village of Gegharkunik region. 

Lusine is a nurse, and for many years she worked in her profession, but unfortunately that work provides too small of an income, so she had to give it up to became engaged in farming and agriculture. On her farm she has a cows and calves, and she is also very seriously busy with potato cultivation. From her farm she sells a perfect sort of potato for which re-sellers give orders beforehand and buy right  from her farm. 

Lusine’s husband is in the Russian Federation and from there he sends money for his family. 

Lucian will use this loan of 200,000 Armenian drams to develop her potato cultivation; she will buy a lot of potato seedlings of a better sort than she has now on her farm.

loans.use: to buy a lot of potato seedlings of a better sort than she has now on her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase iron sheets, cement, nails, and posts to build a house to store his burnt bricks (to prevent them from being rained on and destroyed).

loans.name: Khawasra's 1 Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 20-year-old married farmer who lives with a family of eight members. This family lives in a village named Khawasra located in Gujranwala, Pakistan. He grows rice, wheat, and fodder to sell in nearby market. 

He farms to earn income for his beloved family. Thanks to this work, he has been able to provide for the needs of his family. Muhammad wants to continue having a prosperous rice crop and seeks a loan to  purchase of fertilizer, pesticides, and fuel.  He hopes to get a good harvest this year and increase his income.

Muhammad's wish is that his children will study and become professional people and be of service to others.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Rubik

texts.en:
Rubik and his wife live in the village Gagarin of Gegharkunik region. Rubik is currently unemployed, but is engaged in farming and agriculture. His farm is very cute one, but as he says, he is happy with the care of his two cows, three calves and two piglets. 

Rubik also good in land cultivation; he has very tasty harvest of potatoes, garlic and tomatoes. Rubik’s wife is employed and she works at the local post office. So alone, little by little but very properly, Rubik takes care of his farm and cattle on it. His farm products have sold rather well (he sells milk, cheese and meat). 

This loan will be great for Rubik as he needs to buy fodder for his farm cattle and he will be really happy to get it.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm cattle which he will be really happy to get

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married and has four children, all attending school. She takes care of additional family members. She lives in her own house and has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. 

Betty sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. 

She has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. 

The main business challenge includes seasonality of the clothes. She would like to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  a variety of vegetables and  fertilizer.

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en: Vahe and his wife, daughter, and mother live In the village Gagarin of Gegharkunik region. Vahe used to work  as a locksmith, but now he combines his work with farming. He has 5 cows and 3 calves. He sells his farm’s milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, curd, and meat. Vahe is the  bread-winner of his family and faces financial hardships. He will use the Kiva loan  to buy one  cow and  fodder.

loans.use: to buy one a cow and odder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, mats and grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently, increase her net income, and improve their standard of living.

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en: A mother of two schoolchildren living in Siem Reap province, Hun is 41 years old. She grows rice as her main source of income and works for others for pay to supplement her income. She has been involved in her business for ages, and she earns an income of about 25,000 KHR per day. Her rice has not been growing well, because of the drought. This is her fourth loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has completely repaid her past loans. With her past loans, she received more income and updated her lifestyle, and kept her children in school. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pay plowing fees. She hopes that she can get more income from her business to improve her living standard and increase the productivity of her crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Prasat Bakong district

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine is 46 years old, married, and has 10 children, five of whom are attending school.  He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He owns a mobile money business and works 7 days a week, 12 hours per day, in order to generate income. He is a hardworking, honest and competent man who also engages in farming, charging phones, and selling soft drinks, as additional sources of income. He is still faced with a challenge of limited capital. Augustine is applying for a loan to boost his mobile money business, so as to generate more income and fulfill his future plans of educating his children.

loans.use: to boost his mobile money business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 24 years old and lives with her beloved husband and her father-in-law in Gagarin village of Gegharkunik region. 

Anna has a higher medical education and now she works at the city hospital as a midwife. She also is engaged in farming with her husband. On the farm she has cows, calves and chickens. She sells milk, cheese, curd, meat and eggs from her farm. Anna mentions that she likes farming activities very much and she would like to enlarge the farm very much. 

So she asks a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy a cow, a calf and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a cow, a calf and also fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 44-year-old farmer; he lives with 7 family members.  He lives in a village called Allah Ditta located in Pakistan. He is the group leader, standing in the picture with with his arm raised and holding a booklet. He and his group members are working with the JWS Microfinance Institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities to grow rice and wheat on their land. They are on their fifth group loan with the institution and their previous loans have been properly repaid.

They are requesting a loan to purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, seeds, pesticides and to pay the fee of the land preparation. 

This loan will help them to increase their farm output, to enable them to invest the extra income in their family's well-being.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, fuel etc.

loans.name: Sugra

texts.en: Sugra is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a tailoring business at her home, as her husband’s income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Sugra is popular, and she is known in her area for her sewing skills. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulties in meeting the daily expenses of her business. For this reason, she has applied for for a loan of PKR 40,000. With the loan, she wants to purchase sewing materials, such as threads and wool of various colors, as well as cloth, so she can produce more dresses on time. She hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials, such as thread and wool of various colors, along with cloth, to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Vicenta Del Transito

texts.es: Doña Vicenta de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de cereales (maíz, frijoles, maicillo) tiene 12 años de dedicarse a  ese negocio el cual inicio con capital propio, almacena sus productos en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, para luego comercializarlos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, Doña Vicenta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas cereales por mayor para tener siempre el producto para su venta y poder obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Vincenta, 54, lives in her own house with her daughter.  She has a business selling cereals (corn, beans, sorghum).  She's had this business, which she started with her own capital, for 12 years.  She stores her products in the silos shown in the photograph.  Later she sells these products in the areas surrounding the neighborhood where she lives.  Vincenta is requesting a loan to buy more cereals at wholesale so that she will always have product on hand to sell.  This way she can generate more earnings.

loans.use: to buy cereals at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pork, vegetables, and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Liborio Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Liborio tiene 54 años de edad, vive en arrendada junto con su esposa en la ciudad de Santo Domingo.
Liborio, trabaja en el centro de la ciudad él vende variedades como calculadoras, grabadoras, controles y demás, lleva ya más de 10 años de experiencia y comenta que gracias a este negocio él pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos que ahora son todos unos profesionales. Su esposa también trabaja, ella recorre vendiendo cosméticos.
En vista de que se aproximan la fiestas de la ciudad Liborio quiere comprar mercadería, por eso con este crédito comprará  artículos varios para surtir y aprovechar esta época buena en ventas.
Se siente feliz porque con este crédito y la ayuda de KIVA crecerá como microempresario, luego en futuro quiere también que su esposa tenga un local fijo para su negocio.
texts.en:
Liborio, 54, lives in a rented dwelling with his wife in the city of Santo Domingo.  He works in the center of the city selling merchandise such as calculators, tape recorders, electronic controllers, and other items.  He has more than 10 years of experience in this line of work, and he comments that thanks to this business he was able get ahead with his children, who are now all professionals.  His wife also works; she goes out from place to place to sell cosmetics.

Seeing that the festivals in the city are approaching, Liborio wants to buy merchandise.  He will use this loan to buy a variety of items to stock up his business so that he will be able to take advantage of this season for good sales.

Liborio feels happy, because with this loan and the help of Kiva, he will grow as a small businessman.  Later, in the future, he also wants his wife to have a fixed location for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Didas

texts.en:
Didas is 34 years old, and married with one child. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has operated a general store for two years now to earn a living. He earns a monthly salary from the local government as another source of income. He has hopes of having a fully stocked business and a healthy life in future. However, limited capital is a challenge. 

Dias is seeking credit to buy soft drinks for selling.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell like sodas, quenchers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase iron sheets, cement, nails, and posts.

loans.name: Mery Susana

texts.es:
Susana es una señora de 47 años, vive junto a su esposo en casa propia en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, un sector muy productivo y comercial, caracterizado por ser el puente que une a las regiones del país.
A Susana siempre le ha gustado la costura, anteriormente tuvo un pequeño taller pero por falta de capital no puedo adquirir máquinas necesarias para el negocio. Ahora se encuentra trabajando como docente de niños, pero aun así en ocasiones sigue cosiendo a veces prestando máquinas para terminar el trabajo.  Por ello Susana con este crédito podrá hacer su sueño realidad, comprará una maquina industrial recubridora y una maquina trilladora que son muy indispensables para continuar de forma permanente con su taller de costura. Está muy feliz porque podrá realizar prendas de vestir y así en un futuro tener un taller grande en donde pueda dar trabajos a terceras personas que lo necesiten.
Susana y su esposo están muy agradecidos con KIVA por permitir que las personas puedan tener su propia microempresa.
texts.en:
Susana is a 47 year old woman.  She lives with her husband in their own house in the city of Santo Domingo, a very productive and commercial area known to be the bridge uniting different regions of the country.

Susana has always liked sewing, and once had a small workshop, but because of lack of capital could not buy the machines needed for the business.  Now she works teaching children but even so sometimes continues sewing, borrowing machines to finish the work.  So with this loan Susan can make her dream reality.  She will buy an industrial cover stitch machine and a double-needle sewing machine, which are indispensable in order to operate her dressmaking shop in a permanent form.  She is very happy because she will be able to create  high quality garments, and thus in the future have a big shop where she can offer work to other people who need it.   

Susana and her husband are grateful to KIVA for allowing people to have their own small businesses.

loans.use: to begin her business of sewing and making garments and with this investment eventually have a big shop.

loans.name: Flora Maria

texts.es:
Flora es una señora de 59 años,  vive junto a su esposo y un hijo que actualmente está estudiando la universidad, habitan en la parroquia de Valle Hermoso, un pueblo caracterizado por ser una zona turística.
Flora comenta que hace años atrás ella trabajó con crédito en la Fundación donde pudo fortalecer su tienda, actualmente ha crecido en el negocio incluso se dedica a la producción de pollos; trabaja todos los días sin descanso ya que con estos ingresos ella puede ayudar a su hijo en la universidad, mientras su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y a la producción agrícola.
Flora con este crédito podrá surtir más su tienda y también podrá comprar más pollitos y balanceado. Está feliz y muy agradecida con KIVA, porque así podrá seguir creciendo y apoyando a su hijo en sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Flora is a 59 year old woman. She lives together with her husband and son who is currently studying at university. They live in Valle Hermoso parish, a community that is a tourist destination.

Flora comments that years ago she worked with loans from the Fundación which she used to strengthen her store. Currently she is expanding her business including working raising chickens. She works tirelessly every day as with this income she can help her son at university while her husband works as a bricklayer and in agricultural production.

With this loan Flora can stock her store more and also buy more chicks and balanced feed. She is happy and very grateful to Kiva as she can continue to grow and support her son with his university studies.

loans.use: to stock her business and also buy feed for the chicks she is raising and with the extra income continue to support her son at university.

loans.name: Jóvenes Del Sector Cuy Group

texts.es:
Rodolfo (el primero del lado derecho de chumpa color rojo) es un hombre de 24 años de edad, es soltero  y tiene un hijo de dos meses, ellos viven en una comunidad del departamento de Sololá. Rodolfo es un gran hombre y un buen padre de familia, el para poder obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia cuenta con un pequeño negocio de café internet, esta labor lo tiene el hace apenas tres meses, pero para poder mejorar sus ingresos trabaja como vendedor en una tienda de consumo diario, Rodolfo con el afán de hacer de su negocio prospero organizo a un grupo de personas que tiene el mismo fin para juntos solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de más computadoras y para surtir mejor su negocio compra de USB, memorias micro, CDS entre otros.
Rodolfo tiene las esperanzas de construir una casa donde su familia pueda vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Rodolfo (on the right of the photo in the red jacket) is 24 years old. He is single and has a son who is 2 months old. They live in a community in the department of Sololá. Rodolfo is a great man and a good father figure. In order to be able to make an income and move his family forward he has a small internet café business. He has had this job for barely three months, but he works as a salesperson in a shop selling daily consumables so he can improve his income.

Keen to make his business successful, Rodolfo got together a group of people with the same aims so that together they can apply for a loan which he will invest in buying more computers and stock his business better by buying USB flash drives, micro memory, CDs and other items. Rodolfo has hopes of building a house where his family can live better.

loans.use: to buy computers, USB flash drives, micro memory cards, CDs.

loans.name: Allah Ditta 5 Group

texts.en:
Ahmad is a young farmer. He is standing in the middle along with his group members in the picture. He is 35 years old and lives in a village called Allah Ditta in Gujranwala district in Pakistan.

He grows rice and wheat for his family's consumption and to sell the extra produce in a nearby market, since in this way he generates income to cover other family necessities. He has a lot of experience, given that from a young age he began working in the fields helping his parents in order to subsist.

He and his group members are requesting a loan in order to buy agricultural supplies with which they will initiate the preparation of the land in which they will plant rice, as well as pay the fee for labor. It will be useful to them to increase the area under cultivation and to have a more abundant harvest.

Ahmad's aspirations are to store the harvest for the family’s consumption and to have future sales at the best price.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture inputs: fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, fuel, etc.

loans.name: Asad's Group

texts.en:
Asad is the young farmer standing in the middle of the photo raising his hand. He lives in a village called Chak Sadhoo in Gujranwala District in Pakistan. He and his group members are progressive farmers who cultivate rice, wheat, and vegetables on their farms.

They are requesting a loan to procure input supplies for their rice crops. By acquiring this loan, they will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seeds that will help them to increase their yield.

This loan will help them to considerably increase their household incomes so they may use their extra earnings to acquire more land for agriculture.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs like fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, and fuel.

loans.name: Consuelo Esperanza

texts.es: Consuelo de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 6 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 41, lives in her own home with her two children.  For 6 years, she's had a business making and selling pupusas (stuffed corncakes).  This business is located near her home in a very busy area.  With her earnings from this business she is able to cover some of the household expenses.  

Consuelo is requesting a loan to buy pork rinds, cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients so that she can continue with this work, which generates good earnings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Rodes Etelvina

texts.es: Doña Rodea de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 6 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rodea, 36, lives in her own home with her life partner and her daughter.  She's had a small store for 6 years which is located in her home.  She sells a variety of products there, including sweets, beverages, consumer staples, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatins, sugar, etc.  She has a lot of customers due to her low prices.  Rodea is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale, because this store is her only source of income.  This way, she can increase her earnings and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis was pleased by his first Kiva deal, and thanks all the lenders who helped him with his first loan. Now, he hopes for one more profitable deal with Kiva and Nor Horizon. 

Sargis lives in the frontier village of Lusadzor in the Tavush region. With his wife, Sargis still runs a farming and agriculture business. Currently on his farm he has cows, calves, pigs and a lot of chickens. On his plot of land Sargis has nice orchard full of apple, fig, and pear trees. He also cultivates cucumber, tomato, beans and other crops. 

Sargis with this partnership hopes to increase his farm cattle. He will also buy several piglets and fodder for all of his farm cattle.

loans.use: To buy several piglets and also fodder for all of his farm cattle

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom is 24 years old and married with one child. They are living in a rural village of the Battambang province. Her main source of income is from rice crop, which she has been doing for ten years. Moreover, she earns more income via working for others for a fee. She can earn income of about 37,800 KHR per day.

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy seed and fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee.

She hopes that she can get more income to update her family’s condition better than before.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a 23-year-old married  man with a 3-year-old child who attends school.  They live in Mitukula in the Rakai district.  Yusuf is a hard working and determined man. 
Yusuf has sold saucepans since 2011.  He works 7 days a week and 12 hours per day to have a daily income.

Yusuf wants 4,000,000 UGX to buy more saucepans and other related items to meet the demand for his clients. He is challenged by inadequate capital to expand the business and beat the competition.
 
Yusuf appreciates the Kiva lenders' contribution to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy kitchen ware.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 42 years old. He is a resident of Lutete in Rakai district. He is married with ten children; only three still attend school, and the others completed school.

He carries out a business of faming, which he started in 2000. He works seven days a week and twelve hours per day and started this business with the aim of improving his daily income.

Richard wants a loan of UGX 3,000,000 for boosting his coffee yields by buying organic fertilizers and hiring labour to prune and weed the coffee plantation. His customers are the coffee traders in the same village and other areas. However, his challenges are lack of enough capital to expand the business, and competition.

Richard is a hardworking man who always looks at development.

loans.use: to boost his coffee business by buying organic fertilizers and hiring labour.

loans.name: Marie Odette

texts.fr:
Marie Odette est une femme courageuse et travailleuse infatigable. Elle a en ce moment 64 ans. Elle est veuve , mère d'un enfant et grand-mère de deux petits enfants. Ces derniers vivent avec elle car leurs parents travaillent dans la brousse où les écoles sont très loin et l'accès est très difficile.
Marie Odette dirige un gargote, il y a maintenant 33 ans. C'est une activité qu'elle héritait de ses parents, et facile pour elle de la continuer. Elle habite dans sa propre maison, et à part le gargote, elle exploite un  élevage de porc et de vache laitière. 
Son objectif est d'améliorer son affaire, de le développer et de le renforcer afin de prévoir sa vieillesse et sa retraite.
texts.en:
Marie Odette is a brave and hardworking lady.  She is currently 64 years old.  She is a widow, mother of one child and has two grandchildren.  Her grandchildren live with her because their parents both work in the bush where schools are scarce and access is very difficult.  

Marie Odette has been running a small restaurant for 33 years now.  It is a business that she inherited from her parents which was easy for her to continue.  She lives in her own house, and apart from the restaurant, she operates a breeding farm with pigs and dairy cows.  Her aim is to improve her business, to develop it and strengthen it before she reaches retirement.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish and rice

loans.name: Chadyala 1 Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 34-year-old married man. He has  farmed for 10 years growing rice and wheat. He lives in the village of Chadyala which is  located in province Punjab, Pakistan. 

Muhammad's main business hardship is the lack of capital. He and other group members need a  loan to purchase adequate seeds and farm supplies.

Muhammad is a reputable person in the community. All members agreed to elect him as leader of their solidarity group. He hopes for his children to find good jobs, his business to do well, and his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, seeds, and fuel.

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: Oscar de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, él es empleado de servicios domésticos desde hace 6 años y con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de construir su casa pero no tiene suficiente capital para hacerlo por esa razón solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar los materiales de construcción necesarios y pago de mano de obra para poder tener una vivienda más digna.
texts.en: Oscar, 36, lives in his own home with his wife.  He has been employed in domestic services for 6 years, and with with his earnings he is able to cover some of the household expenses.  Oscar wants to finish building his home, but he lacks the money to do this.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy the construction materials he needs and to pay for labor.  This way he will be able to have a more decent home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor to finish his home

loans.name: Carlos Alonso

texts.es: Don Carlos de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee un taller de calzado,  repara y elabora calzado, su taller lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela por la calidad del producto, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cuero, hilo, pega, tela, etc. para seguir con su elaboración ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo  y así tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos, 50, lives in his own home with his family group.  He has a cobbler shop where he repairs and makes shoes.  His workshop is located in his home.  He has a lot of customers due to the quality of his products.  With the earnings from his sales, he manages to cover the household expenses.  

Carlos is requesting a loan to buy leather, thread, glue, fabric, etc., so that he can continue with his business making shoes, because this is his only source of work.  This way, he and his family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy leather, thread, glue, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Topi Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a 44-year-old mother of two, a boy and a girl. She is married and supports her family by selling handbags and shoes door to door, a business she has been in for three years. She works from 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. daily and is able to realize a small monthly profit. 

Joyce is now requesting her third loan from Kiva's partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She will manage to repay her loan successfully. Her capital base is still small, so she is requesting a loan so that she can improve her business inventory to earn maximum income. She wants to expand her projects and be better in life, and also to rent a room so as to have permanent place for her business. 

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group, called Topi, which has three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to improve her business inventory to earn maximum income

loans.name: Matiya

texts.en:
Matiya is a 41-year-old married man with 5 children, all attend school.  They live in Kasese Uganda. 

He sells sugar, soap, rice , soda and other items and works 12 hours a day, 7 days a week. He is a hardworking and honest person with a dream of expanding his business.  He is  challenged by  inadequate capital. 

He requests a loan to buy  soda, cooking oil, sugar, salt, cassava flour, and general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda, cooking oil, sugar, salt, cassava flour, and general merchandise.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable, tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a sus cinco hijos de las edades entre 15 y 28 años en una comunidad de san marcos la laguna. El para poder sacar adelante a su amada familia trabaja como policía municipal, en su comunidad esta labor lo ejerce el desde hace cuatro años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos es agricultor siembra una serie de hortalizas, para Marcos el que sus hijos cuenten con lo necesario para poder estudiar es muy importante, es por ello que le preocupa mucho que su hija quien  cursa en último año de diversificado  no cuente con una computadora, es el motivo que impulsa a Marcos para solicitar un crédito y así poder comprarle a su hija la computadora que tanta falta le ha hecho.
El gran sueño de Marcos es que su hija se gradué para  brindarle todo sus apoyo en la universidad el próximo año.
texts.en:
Marcos is a hard-working and very responsible man. He is 48 years old, is married, and lives with his 5 children who are between 15 and 28 years of age in a community in San Marcos La Laguna. In order to provide for his much-loved family, he works as a local policeman in his community. He has been doing this job for four years, but to improve his income he is a farmer and grows a range of vegetables. 

For Marcos it is very important for his children to have what they need so they can study, and this is why he is very concerned that his daughter, who is in her last year of high school, does not have a computer. 

This is the reason which motivates Marcos to ask for a loan so he can buy his daughter the computer which she has needed so much. Marcos' biggest dream is for his daughter to graduate from high school so he can give her all his support for university this coming year.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery es una mujer de 41 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos y productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio. 
Ella es inteligente, emprendedora, optimista, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su Trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘Sagrado corazón de jesus’ situada sobre la ladera oeste de la ciudad, donde las calles son pendientes y empinadas. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Mery es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello largo negro lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar fideo, arroz, refrescos, galletas, productos de limpieza, etc., en su tienda de barrio, debido a la ubicación y a la falta de comercio en el área no tiene mucha competencia por lo que su negocio es un éxito. Su actividad que realiza de forma independiente  y continua durante todos los días de la semana en horario del día, “mi tienda funciona perfecto, los clientes me exigen material de librería y es el nuevo rubro que pienso emprender…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que se encuentra bien ubicado y las ventas son buenas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para ofrecer el servicio de librería y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Su sueño es abrir una empresa distribuidora para realizar ventas por mayor, ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de una fotocopiadora y muebles mostradores para abrir una librería, ya que hay una escuela cercana y existe demanda de ese servicio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Mery solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina fotocopiadora y muebles mostradores para abrir una librería.
texts.en:
Mery is a 41-year-old woman. She is single, has no children, and runs a neighborhood store where she sells groceries and basic items. Mery is intelligent, enterprising, optimistic, has a good attitude, is committed to her work, responsible, and very hard-working. She works in the Sacred Heart of Jesus section on the western slope of the city, where streets are sloped and steep. The city's temperature is cold and dry, with a temperature that varies between 0 to 12 degrees C during the day. 

Mery is brown-skinned, brown-eyed, short, slim, and wears her long black hair tied back. She is a native speaker of Aymara, which she speaks with her family. Mery also speaks Spanish thanks to her general knowledge and business dealings. In her neighborhood store she sells groceries and basic items such as bread, sugar, noodles, rice, soft drinks, cookies, cleaning products, etc. Due to her store's location and the lack of commercial activity in the area, her business does not face much competition and is thus a successful. She works on her own every day of the week during daytime hours. "My store works perfectly. My clients have asked for office supplies and thus that is the new project I plan to engage in..." she says. The advantage of her business is its good location and healthy sales; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to invest in a stationery store and meet her clients' needs. Her dream is to open a wholesale distribution business. She would like to expand her business by purchasing a photocopier and display counters to open a stationery store to meet existing demand from the neighboring school. This is her first round of loans in the five years that she has been in business. These are the reasons why Mery is requesting a loan to purchase a photocopier and display counters to open a stationery store.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopier and display counters to open an stationery store.

loans.name: Celia Beronica

texts.es: Celia, tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos, y reside actualmente en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Hace 7 años que se dedica al cultivo de cafe, el cual vende en la misma zona donde vive. Con esta actividad apoya a los gastos del hogar. Esta solicitando un prestamo por 6,000 lempiras para comprar abono y aplicarle a su finca de cafe para sacar mejor produccion. Con sus ganancias piensa comprar otro terreno para cultivar mas cafe y poderle ayudar a sus hijos dandole calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Celia is 35 years old. She is married, and she has two children. Currently, she lives in the city of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. For the past 7 years, she has made a living cultivating coffee, which she sells in the area where she lives. With this work, she helps cover household expenses.

She is requesting a loan of 6,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer for her coffee farm in order to obtain a better yield. With her earnings, she hopes to buy another plot of land for coffee cultivation so that she can help her children and give them a decent life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee farm.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel, de 51 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que no tenían la posibilidad económica, está casado desde hace 18 años, la esposa se dedica al comercio, porque los días de semana trabaja en el mercado, tiene una hija de 16 años de edad.

Manuel, se dedica a la prestación de servicio de trasporte desde hace 10 años, inicio a trabajar con moto-taxis debido a la necesidad de empleo y de llevar el alimento a la casa; desde entonces se ha dedicado a esta actividad y es de ahí de donde ha logrado sacar adelante a su hija.- Manuel, se levanta todos los días a las 5 de la mañana, para viajar a la ciudad que está a una distancia de 4 kilómetros desde su casa.

Manuel, necesita el dinero para comprar un vehículo para trabajar en la misma ciudad, porque en la moto-taxis no puede llevar cosas pesadas.

Manuel, sueña con tener su propia moto-taxi y también desea ser un empresario de trasporte público para obtener mejores ganancias y darle la oportunidad a su hija para que estudie en la universidad.
texts.en:
51-year old Manuel wasn't able to go to school because of his family's financial situation. He has been married for 18 years. His wife is a businesswoman and works daily in the market. He has a 16-year old daughter.

Manuel has worked in the transportation sector for 10 years. He started out working with motorbike taxis because he needed the work in order to put food on the table. Since then he has continued to provide transportation services and that is how he has managed to provide for his daughter. He gets up every day at 5am to travel to town, a distance of 4km from his house.

He is now seeking a loan to buy a vehicle for his work, as motorbike taxis are not suitable for heavy goods. His dream is to own his own motorbike taxi as well as a public transportation business. Then he will earn more money and be able to provide his daughter with the opportunity to go to university.

loans.use: buy a vehicle for work in the town

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities, like biscuits, cooking oil, noodles, seasonings, sugar, and other items.  

She is a 50-year-old, widowed woman with four dependents. Her youngest child is 13 and is still attending school. It has been almost six years now that Victoria has been engaged in that kind of business. She lives in Getafe, Bohol.

Victoria is asking for a loan to buy assorted goods, like soft drinks, liquor, and canned goods. These will fill her store with a variety of stocks and she will be able to attract more buyers to come visit. Thus, her income will be augmented and she will be able to handle her finances. Victoria could continue to support the schooling of her youngest child and provide food for healthy diets.

With the additional capital, Victoria could start to expand her business, allowing it to become sustainable and she would be able to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods, like soft drinks, liquor, and canned goods.

loans.name: Qila Bhattian 1 Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is 46 years old and married, and his wife looks after the household tasks. They have 5 children. He is standing in the group with his hand raised. He is a leader of four members and a resident of the village of Qila Bhattian, Tehsile Noshera Virkan in Pakistan.

Muhammad has over 25 years experience in cultivating the land and grows rice and wheat to feed his family. He wants to better feed his children and dreams of educating them in good schools with good customs.

He is asking for this loan to buy supplies for the rice season, so that with this harvest he can be sure of having money to satisfy the needs of his household and feeding his family. He has to buy 25 bags of fertilizer and 8 boxes of pesticides for his rice crop. His yield will increase after using these inputs. 

Muhammad hopes to have a very good harvest and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticides, seeds, and fuel.

loans.name: Dera Sardaran Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is standing in the middle, raising his hand in the group photo. He is a poor farmer living in Dera Sardaran, a native village of the Gujranwala district, in Pakistan. He is 48 years old and has six dependents in his family. He is a leader of three farmers. 

Muhammad had used conventional farming techniques in the past and had to approach middle men to purchase agriculture inputs. Middle men provided him agri inputs while pledging his upcoming produce and exploited him to procure his produce for much less than its actual prices. His lender JWS replaced the role of middle men and provided him an alternate source of financing.

He along with his group members have to purchase agri-inputs such as fertilizer, quality seeds, fuel, pesticides & herbicide etc for their rice crop. They are requesting a loan to buy input supplies.This loan will enable them to sell their harvest in the open market to earn more profit. Their living standard will be improved and they will get rid of the conventional middle men trap.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, fuel, etc

loans.name: José Salomón

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 20 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj,  para Jose poder salir a trabajar todos los días bajo el ardiente sol, es una gran bendición pues con el sudor de la frente genera sus ingresos y mantiene a su familia, él es jornalero y tiene 10 años de realizarlo pues empezó desde niño, Jose es un joven lleno de sueños y metas, y uno de sus más grandes aspiraciones es la construcción de su casa, aunque una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no cuenta con suficiente dinero para poder adquirir sus materiales  de construcción por tal razón solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir esta necesidad.
El gran sueño de Jose es poder construir su casa para brindarle a su familia más comodidad y comprar un terreno para cultivar.
texts.en:
Jose, 20, is married and lives with his wife in the community of San Andres Semetabaj.  For Jose, the ability to go out to work every day under the blazing sun is a great blessing, because with the sweat of his brow he can generate income to support his family.  

Jose is a day worker who's been doing this work for 10 years, as he started when he was a child.  Jose is a youth who is full of dreams and goals. One of his greatest aspirations is to build his own house.  However, a difficulty he faces is that he lacks the money to buy the construction materials he needs.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to cover these expenses.

Jose's greatest dream is to be able to build his own house so that he can provide his family with greater comfort.  He would also like to buy some land to cultivate.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Laura Edelmira

texts.es: Laura de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus seis hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado, cerdos y cultiva de maíz, frijol y maicillo desde hace 10 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, ella está solicitando un crédito para al compra de semillas, abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas, herbicidas y adema comprar ganado pequeños para engorde y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Laura is 33-years-old and lives in her own home with her six children. For the last ten years she has made a living raising cattle and pigs, and growing corn, beans, and sorghum. Laura sells her products in the different markets near her home. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide, and small livestock for meat production, in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide, and small livestock for meat production.

loans.name: Marta Araceli

texts.es: Marta de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos,  ella posee un tienda desde hace 5 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para al compra de leche, huevos, granos básicos, aceite, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Marta is 36-years-old and lives in her own home with her husband and three children. For five years she has owned a store that is located in her home. Marta has many clients due to her good prices and courteous service. She is requesting a loan to purchase milk, eggs, basic grains, oil, sweet bread, etc. and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase milk, eggs, basic grains, oil, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and feed to start a hog business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables and pork as well as pay for her daughter's school allowance

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 58 years old, married to Josephine, and supports four children. He has been a farmer for the last two years, and the business earns him KES 14,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops. This will enable him to reap a better harvest for family use and surplus to sell in the market. 

He plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and to educate his children to higher levels of education. His hope is to expand his agricultural business and start a retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops, enabling him to get a better harvest for family use and for sale of the surplus in the market.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 48 years old and lives in Geghamavan village in the Gegharkunik region. She lives with her husband and son. 

Karine and her husband earn their family living through farming and agriculture. On her farm she has cows, calves, bulls, heifers, sheep, bee families, and chickens. On her plot of land Karine cultivates potato, greens, and carrots. She sells all her farm products at the city wholesale market during the week. 

Karine needs this loan for her potato cultivation development. With this loan amount she will buy potato seedlings, fertilizer, and also some fodder for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer, and fodder for her cattle.

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en: Hranush is 63 years old and with her husband she lives in Kapan city of the Syunik region. Hranush has higher medical education. For several years she worked at the hospital as a nurse, but now she works at the kindergarten. Hranush’s children are married and they live with their families. In a nearby village, Srashen, Hranush has a plot of land where she decided to plant fruit trees and to establish an orchard and vegetable garden as well.  Hranush asks for this loan as she wants to fence her garden and also repair the irrigation system which is very old and not useful for her garden.

loans.use: to fence her garden and also to repair the irrigation system, which is very old

loans.name: Jefa

texts.en:
Jefa is married and has four children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a business selling fruit and coconuts to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 50,000 KSH loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a small Mexian farmer; he raises hogs, sheep, and cultivates corn to feed his animals. He used to pile his animals' manure up in a corner of his farm, while purchasing expensive LP gas, chemical fertilizers, collecting wood and having his wife cook with woodfuel. Not only was he spending a lot of money, but the raw manure was also attracting swarms of flies, generating bad smells and emitting greenhouse gases. 

By purchasing his biodigester, he is going to bring a drastic and positive change to his living and working environment. Indeed, he will input the manure in the biodigester, where bacteria will treat it and transform it in two productive resources: renewable energy and organic fertilizer. Juan will progressively displace LP gas, wood and chemical fertilizers, generating important savings for his household and farm. 

He will protect the environment, convert to organic farming and improve his family's quality of life. With his savings, he plans to buy a greenhouse to start planting more vegetables for his family's own consumption.
This loan represents 30% of the total price of the biodigester, the remaining part is covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in an 8 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to turn manure in to energy

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.en:
Adolfo is a Mexican farmer who dedicates himself to raising cows, hogs and sheep. He also cultivates green tomatoes on a field close to his farm, which he sells on the local market and uses for his family's own consumption. He decided to invest in a biodigester in order to save money by displacing the expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers, which are unsustainable external inputs on which he used to spend a large portion of his irregular revenue. 

With his biodigester, Adolfo will be able to turn the large quantities of his animals' manure into renewable energy (biogas) and organic fertilizer. The biogas will be directly connected to a new cookstove and the boiler in the house, while Adolfo will be able to replace chemical fertilizers with the nutrient-rich, organic fertilizer produced from his animals' waste. His soil will be nourished in a sustainable manner, providing Adolfo with healthier tomato plants. He sees the biodigester as an opportunity to convert his fields to 100% organic farming.

This loan represents 30% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 20 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester - turning manure into energy

loans.name: Qila Mustafa Abad 1 Group

texts.en:
Muhammad, 36 years old, did not have the opportunity to go to school. He is the group leader raising his hand in the photo. He is married and a father of four children. He works in agriculture, farming to earn the livelihood of his family. He is a resident of a village named Qila Mustafa Abad located in Punjab Province in Pakistan. 

He has been working in the agriculture business since he was 18 years old, a job he learned from his parents. He works in this business because it was the most viable way to earn income. The place he cultivates is near his house in the village, and he goes there by foot from his home.

This loan is necessary to purchase 15 sacks of fertilizers and five boxes of pesticides, to prepare the land, and to pay the rent for his rice crop. He hopes for a better output from his farm. He wants to send his children to school.

His dream is to have a brick house, and he hopes to manage it with work and dedication.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs like fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, and fuel.

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Seyran is eager to have his third Kiva deal, and he is also greatly thankful for his previous two Kiva loans. Seyran is 56 years old and he lives in the city of Vanadzor in the Lori region with his wife. He still manages his fruit and vegetable trading business at the rented stall. He sells a nice and tasty assortment of vegetables and fruits to his regular customers, who during the past years regularly visited his stall because his products are always fresh and the assortment is rather great. 

Seyran obtains the fruits and vegetables from villages in the Ararat region and then transports them to Vanadzor to sell. Seyran request this loan of 300,000 Armenian drams for his business development, and he will refresh his stall’s assortment with the products that are in great demand during the summer period.

loans.use: to refresh his stall’s assortment with the products that are in great demand during the summer

loans.name: Akbar’S Group

texts.en:
Akbar and his group members are farmers by occupation. They are permanent residents of Chak Sadhoo, a far-flung village in the district of Gujranwala, located in Pakistan.

Akbar and his group members have a small land holding in the surrounding area of the village where they cultivate wheat and rice annually. Both of these crops are the sole source of earnings for the group members. 

Among other challenges faced by the farmers of Akbar’s group, most prominent is the lack of funds to finance the agricultural inputs required to cultivate the rice crop. They are requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs. This loan will help them to increase their crop output.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs like fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, and fuel.

loans.name: Majid’S Group

texts.en:
Majid is a 32-year-old farmer, standing in the middle of the group and raising his hand and holding a booklet. He lives in Qila Mustafa Abad, a village located in the district of Gujranwala in Pakistan. 

His family's sources of income are rice farming and growing wheat. Growing vegetables and working on other farms for a fee are additional sources of extra income, and he has been doing this for four years.
  
Majid lacks the financial resources to purchase farming supplies. Therefore he and his group members are requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, seeds and herbicides for their rice crop. This loan will enable them to earn more income and to expand their current business. 

They are committed to repaying as per the schedule.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, fuel, etc.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño Jesús está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de concepción, una zona alejada de la capital del país, donde las integrantes se dedican a actividades rurales.
La Sra. Lourdes es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde tiene su local de venta de bebidas heladas como agua mineral, gaseosas, cervezas, vinos, y whisky. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya vaya mejorando cada día.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de agua mineral, gaseosas, cervezas, vinos, y whisky para la venta. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The Divino Niño Jesús group is in its first loan cycle as part of the women's committee program. The members of the group live in the town of Concepción, which is located far from the country's capital. The local people earn their living in rural jobs.

Sra. Lourdes is one of the group's members. She lives in an area far from the centre of town where she runs a stall selling cold drinks such as mineral water, sodas, beer, wine and whisky. She is pleased with the way her life is going thanks to help received from the Fundación Paraguaya.

Lourdes is seeking a loan to buy mineral water, sodas, beer, wine and whisky for re-sale. Then she can continue growing her business and providing her family with all that they need so they don't have to go without.

loans.use: buy mineral water, sodas, beer, wine and whisky for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mbolatiana Marina

texts.fr:
35 ans, mariée, Mbolatiana Marina est mère de quatre enfants âgés entre 10 à 18 ans. Ces derniers sont tous actuellement scolarisés dans des écoles privées.
Le mari de Mbolatiana est un boucher et quant à elle, elle exerce une activité de vente des couvertures et couettes de seconde main. Les deux époux sont très solidaires et attentionnés pour le bien-être de leurs enfants.
Depuis son partenariat avec CEFOR, on a pu constater de l'amélioration dans son commerce, elle envisage d'ouvrir un second lieu de vente avec le prêt.
Elle désire étendre sa maison d'habitation dès que son épargne lui permettra.
texts.en:
Mbolatiana Marina is a 35 year old married lady who is the mother of four children aged between 10 and 18.  They are all currently attending private schools.  Her husband is a butcher and she has a business selling second-hand bed covers and duvets.  The couple are very close and care greatly about their children's well-being.  

Since becoming a member of CEFOR, she has been able to make improvements in her business, she hopes to open a second shop with the loan.  She wishes to extend her house using her savings.

loans.use: to buy two duvets and second-hand bed covers

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna, 56, lives with family members in a rural area of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of six children, two of whom are still in school. She grows rice and makes wine as the main sources of income. Moreover, she can earn more income via raising pigs. She has been involved in this business for ages, and it earns her about 6.32 USD per day.

Now, her pigs got sick, so Vanna decided to apply for a loan to save her family’s business. Because she had to spend some of her money to cure her pigs, she cannot manage to pay her children’s school fee. She is now applying for a loan to pay for her children’s school fee; this is the first time for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She hopes that this loan will enable her to support her children to get better education, and she wants to support their studies until they graduate.

loans.use: To pay for her children’s school fee

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Srey Sornthou district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mangoes and bananas

loans.name: Ciudad Nueva Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ciudad Nueva  está en su ciclo número 2, las integrantes se dedican a la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas buscan un mejor porvenir para sus familias y también buscan salir de la situación de pobreza de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liliana quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras frescas que vende de manera ambulante. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que lucha por poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras frescas para la venta, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por un mejor porvenir par sus seres queridos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de ayudar a los que ella mas quiere.
texts.en: The Ciudad Nueva group is in its second cycle. The members are engaged in the poverty elimination survey, where all members seek a better future for their families and also look out for the poverty situation of one another. One of the members is Liliana who sells fresh fruit and vegetables as a street vendor. She is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person who fights to grow and improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones. She requests this loan to buy fresh fruit and vegetables to sell so that she can keep up with her sales, fighting for a better future for her loved ones. She is grateful for this opportunity to help those that she loves most.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Abdul’S Group

texts.en:
Abdul and his group members are farmers by occupation. They are permanent residents of Chadayala, a far-flung village in the district of Gujranwala in Pakistan.

Abdul and his group members have a small landholding in the surroundings of the village, where they cultivate wheat and rice on a seasonal basis. Both of these crops are the sole source of earning for the group members. 

The most prominent of the challenges faced by the farmers of Abdul’s group is the lack of funds to finance the farm inputs required to cultivate their rice crop. Therefore they are eagerly looking for a loan to finance these much needed farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, fuel, etc.

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is a poor farmer from Khawasra, a remote village in Gujranwala District in Pakistan. He is a progressive farmer and strives to increase the yield of his crops by employing an optimum mix of agricultural inputs. 

One of the biggest challenges he and his group members face is that of financing the purchase of agricultural inputs. When they had no other option, they had to rely on middle men who pledged the farmers' upcoming crop against the inputs provided and paid lesser prices compared to prevailing market rates. Muhammad and his group is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs, which will release them from the manipulation of these middle men and allow them to sell their crops at prevailing market rates, increasing their rate of return.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs like fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, and fuel.

loans.name: Qila Mustfa Abad 2 Group

texts.en:
Muhammad, a 45-year-old married farmer, has worked for the past 25 years in the agriculture business. He is the leader of his group of two farmers and is raising his hand in this photo. There are six members in his family. He plants rice, wheat, and vegetables on his agricultural land to feed his family.

He sells his products in the markets that are near to his village. He has a small grocery store in his village, along with his agribusiness, to earn his family income. He is a resident of Qila Mustfa Abad, a village located in Gujranwala, Pakistan. He is a hardworking and honest person.

Muhammad is requesting a loan to purchase 2 bags of quality rice seeds, 15 bags of fertilizers, 5 boxes of pesticides, and a fee to plant rice on his farm. He hopes to earn more income from this yield.

His family’s living standard will be improved after utilizing this loan. He dreams to better feed his family.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture inputs: fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, fuel, etc.

loans.name: Bahorgul

texts.en:
Bahorgul is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1978. She is living in a village with her family. She is a widow and has two children. Since 2012, she has been doing business cooking pastries called pirashki and selling them. Beside that activity, she works at a secondary school as a cleaning woman. 

During these years, she has become experienced, so she knows her duties well. She has not had any vacation during these years, and she has become tired and sick. Currently, she needs treatment, but she does not have the money to be treated at the hospital. She appealed to IMON to get a loan to go to the hospital to be treated. She is willing to be supported, because she is one who feeds her family. Bahorgul is responsible to take care of her children, and it would be better for her to be healthy and continue her activities.

loans.use: to go to the hospital to be treated

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr:
Justine a 43 ans actuellement. C'est une femme travailleuse et courageuse. Elle est mariée et son mari est maçon tâcheron donc son revenu n'est pas régulier et il se porte garant dans le contrat de prêt. Ils ont quatre enfants et qui sont tous scolarisés.
Elle est une artisane méticuleuse et perfectionniste. Elle fabrique des paniers avec des matières  en plastiques. Elle  possède beaucoup d'années d'expérience en la matière. et elle a beaucoup de clients revendeurs en ce moment même.
Elle vise à étendre et développer son activité afin de pouvoir améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille ainsi que l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Justine is currently 43 years old. She is a hard-working and brave woman. She is married and her husband is a drudge builder, therefore they do not have a regular income and he is a guarantor in the loan contract.  They have four children, who are all educated.  

Justine is a meticulous artist. She makes baskets with plastic materials, She has many years experience in the subject.  She has many customers who at the moment who resell her items.  She plans to extend and develop her business so she can improve the family's living standards along with her children's education.

loans.use: to buy plastic materials to weave

loans.name: Martik

texts.en:
Martik is a farmer who lives with his wife and three children in Zovaber village of Gegharkunik region. Martik has two daughters and a son. He is a builder, but mainly a farmer. He has a not-small farm, where he takes care of cows, calves, a bull, a pig, lambs, sheep, and chickens (he sells milk, meat, and eggs).

Potato cultivation brings the main part of family income, since Martik’s farm potatoes are very tasty, and all his customers, especially re-sellers, hurry to buy large amounts of his farm potatoes.

Martik will use this loan to buy potato seedlings, diesel fuel, and some fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, diesel fuel, and some fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Yehowa Akwei Group

texts.en:
These members form a group called Yehowa Akwei. They are on their eighth loan cycle with ID Ghana. The group has five members. They sell wigs, lace, phone credit cards, charcoal, maize, millet, tea, bread, eggs and groceries. 

The featured borrower is Aisha, who is 32 years old and married with children. This loan benefits the small group of micro-entrepreneurs where Aisha is a member. She says that this is the eighth time she has taken a loan with ID Ghana. She joined through an invitation from a cousin who is a member of the institution. Currently, Aisha has a business selling wigs, weavon and lace. She buys wigs, weavon and lace from the main market at wholesale prices and sells them to her customers. She says that the business started with a little capital she had and that it still will need financial support. That is why she has come to ID Ghana, so that she can grow the business. The group will need a total amount of GHS 12,100 to grow their businesses, and they will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

They are grateful to Kiva for supporting ID Ghana to help the needy and making them work to get their daily bread.

loans.use: To buy wigs, weavon and lace from the main market at wholesale prices and sell them to her customers.

loans.name: Khawasra 5 Group

texts.en:
Muhammad and his group members are farmers by occupation. They are permanent residents of the village Khawasra, a remote village in district Gujranwala in Pakistan.

Muhammad and his group members cultivate rice and wheat crops in a seasonal manner. The soil of the region is very fertile for rice crop provided a right mix of agricultural inputs is utilized during and after cultivation. Unfortunately, the group members are very poor and do not have the finances available to purchase the required quantity of fertilizers, fuel and pesticides. 

Therefore, they are looking for a loan to finance their required agricultural inputs. This loan will enable them to increase their farm output. They are committed to returning it in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel etc.

loans.name: Jean Robert

texts.fr:
Jean Robert est un jeune homme très simple mais débrouillard de 24 ans. Il est encore célibataire. Il est originaire de la province, mais pour des raisons de gagner sa vie, il s'est migré dans le capital en 2011. Depuis lors, il exerce une activité de vente des vêtements fripes. 
Son projet est d'économiser beaucoup d'argent pour préparer son avenir, avant de fonder une famille. Son ambition est de développer et de renforcer son activité: augmenter les quantités des marchandises et les diversifier.
texts.en:
Jean Robert, age 24, is a simple but resourceful young man. He is still single. Originally from a remote area, he came to the capital in 2011 to make a living and has since been selling second-hand clothing. 

He plans to save lots of money to prepare for the future before starting a family.  His goal is to bolster and expand his activity by increasing and diversifying his selection of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy used pullovers for resale.

loans.name: Kasayo

texts.en:
Kasayo is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Kasayo operates a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Kasayo dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Mujeres Por La Vida Group

texts.es:
Mujeres por la vida es un grupo donde todas se ayudan por salir adelante y siempre buscando el crecimiento de cada una de sus integrantes, y la de sus seres queridos. Ellas son muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Estela, quien a través del esfuerzo y trabajo en equipo y la ayuda solidaria dentro del grupo logra salir adelante y concretar su plan de negocios. Ella se dedica a la venta de joyas de todo tipo, y con su esfuerzo y lucha tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Estela solicita  este crédito para la compra de una variedad de joyas, para aumentar su número de productos y así mejorar su negocio y sus ingresos. Agradece por la ayuda que todas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
"Mujeres por la vida" [Women for Life] is a group in which everyone helps one another get ahead and always supports the growth of each of its members and their loved ones. They are very hard working, resourceful women.

One of the members is Estela, who through hard work, team work and the solidarity within the group, manages to succeed and realize her business plan. She sells jewelry of all kinds, and through her efforts and struggle, has the means to help her family and loved ones.

Estela is requesting this loan to purchase a variety of jewelry in order to increase the number of products she offers and thus improve her business and income. She is grateful for the help that all the women are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad and his other three group members are farmers by occupation. They are permanent residents of Chak Sadhoo, a far-flung village in the district of Gujranwala, located in Pakistan.

Muhammad and his group members cultivate rice and wheat crops in a seasonal manner. At the moment, the group members are in the process of cultivating a rice crop that requires agricultural inputs. Since the group members are poor and do not have enough savings to finance the inputs, they are urgently looking for loan that can help them to purchase their inputs such as fertilizer, pesticides, seeds and fuel in timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs like fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Lalainjanahary Anita

texts.fr:
Lalainjanahary Anita est une jeune mère de famille de 27 ans avec deux enfants à charges. Ces derniers vont à une école privée actuellement. Elle est un peu seule à les élever car son mari qui est musicien ne la soutienne pas pour supporter  toutes les charges familiales. C'est un homme vraiment irresponsable.
Elle exerce une activité de vente de friperie pour gagner sa vie. Elle change le type et genre des marchandises suivant la saison donc elle a besoin d'un prêt pour renforcer le fonds de roulement. C'est une femme très courageuse et débrouillarde, ne recule devant quelconques difficultés. 
Elle possède déjà un terrain, sa part d'héritage de la part de ses parents et elle envisage d'y construire une petite maison avec son épargne.
texts.en:
Lalainjanahary Anita, age 27, is a young mother of two dependent children who go to private school. She is raising them mostly on her own as her husband, a musician, is not helping to support the family. He is quite unreliable. 

Lalainjanahary Anita sells second-hand clothing to make a living. She varies her merchandise based on the seasons. She is a very brave and resourceful woman who doesn’t back down from any challenge. She needs a loan to bolster her working capital.
 
Lalainjanahary Anita already owns some land inherited from her parents, and she plans to build a small house with her savings.

loans.use: to buy second-hand jackets and pants.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower is 30 years old, is studying nursing and has lived with his partner for the past seven years. He had been working at a factory but once he started treatment for TB, he had to quit working until he recovered. After treatment, he decided to set up a small convenience store at home with support from his sister. 

Presently, he would like to purchase a large freezer for beer and other cold beverages, which will increase sales at the convenience store.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer for small convenience store

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.ru: Эту женщину зовут Мушарраф. Ей 53 года. Мушараф вдова. Она вместе с сыном и невесткой живут в маленьком городке Конибодом. Конибодом прекрасное место богатое сладкими фруктами и великодушными людьми. Мушараф добрая и миролюбивая женщина. Она в этом городке занимается животноводством вот уже более 20 лет. Мушараф каждое утро начинает с работой на скотном дворе. Благодаря ее деятельности Мушарраф обеспечивает семью молоком и доходом. Сейчас осталось малое количество скотин и Мушараф, хочет увеличить поголовья скот, спасти деятельность и не лишиться источника дохода. Мушараф верит, что ее услышат.
texts.en: This woman is called Musharaf. She is 53 years old. Musharaf is a widow. She lives with her son and daughter-in-law in the small town of Konibodom. Konibodom is a wonderful place rich with sweet fruits and generous-spirited people. Musharaf is a kind and peace-loving woman. She has been rearing animals in this town for more than 20 years. Musharaf starts each morning with work in the cattle yard. Thanks to her business, Musharaf provides her family with milk and income. Now Musharaf has few cows left, and she wants to increase the size of her herd, save her business and avoid losing her source of income. Musharaf believes that she will be heard.

loans.use: to buy a few heads of cattle.

loans.name: Fongyen

texts.en:
Fongyen is married with four children and lives in a four-room house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced a lot of problems in his life including sickness and hard times.
Fongyen will use this loan to buy some parts to repair his taxi. He is very optimistic that this business will succeed because he has been in the taxi business for a long time and has been successful. He has the fear of God and has perfect knowledge about the mechanical techniques. He also gets steady business from his customers.
This loan will help the community in that Fongyen will provide door-to-door service to his customers and will also transport customers and their farm produce from the farm to the market.
With the profit resulting from this loan, Fongyen will be able pay his children’s school fees, improve his family's leaving standard and also expand his business.
He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of lower interest rates, repayment is convenient, and the training offered before the loan disbursement. GHAPE also offers non-financial services which include loan management and social networking.

loans.use: to buy motor parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is from the municipality of Malabuyoc, Cebu. She is 38 years old, married and owns a restaurant. Her husband is her cook and partner in their business. She earns about PHP 5,000 per month and has been in this business for 12 years. Mary Ann is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy ingredients such as pork, vegetables, spices, and flour. She is planning to make her restaurant bigger in the future.

loans.use: to buy pork, vegetables, spices, and flour

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en: Muhammad is a poor farmer from Khawasra, a remote village located in District Gujranwala in, Pakistan. He is a progressive farmer and strives to increase the yield of his crops by employing an optimum mix of agricultural inputs. One of the biggest challenges being faced by him and his group members is the ability to finance the purchase of agricultural inputs. They have had to rely on middlemen who pledge the farmers' upcoming crop against the inputs provided and pay lesser prices compared to prevailing market rates. They are requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs which will release them from manipulation of these middlemen, allowing them to sell their crops at prevailing market rates and increase their rate of return.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seed and fuel.

loans.name: Tsotsoo

texts.en:
Tsotsoo is single and all her children are grown and living on their own. 

She is requesting a loan of GHS 2,000 to buy additional supplies for her business, including fresh fish, which she will fry and sell to her customers. She has been doing business for 15 years and she started this business herself. 

She's taking a loan from ID Ghana to increase her income since she wants to do this business for a very long time. She is happy with the loan that was offered by ID Ghana, giving her more working capital, which allows her to buy more firewood and fresh fish, which she will fry and sell to customers. 

She promises to repay the loan without trouble. This is her ninth loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and fresh fish, which she will fry and sell to customers.

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
