Muhammad and his group members are farmers. They are permanent residents of Chadyala, a far flung town in district Gujranwala in Pakistan. 

Muhammad and his group members grow rice and wheat crops on their land. The soil of the region is very fertile and suitable for rice, provided that a right mix of agricultural inputs is utilized during and after cultivation. Unfortunately, the group members have a very small land holding and do not have finances available to purchase the required quantity of seeds, fertilizers, fuel, and pesticides. 

Muhammad and his group members are requesting a loan, which they will use to buy agriculture inputs. This loan will help them to improve their yield and farm income.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, and fuel .

loans.name: Malkay 1 Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is a leader of three, standing in the middle of this group photo. He is a farmer by occupation and lives in Malkay, a remote village in district Gujranwala in Pakistan. 

He cultivates rice, vegetables and wheat to feed his family. The soil of the region is very fertile for rice crops if a right mix of agricultural inputs is utilized during and after cultivation. Unfortunately, he and the other group members are very poor and do not have finances available to purchase the required quantity of fertilizers, fuel and pesticides. 

They requested a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizer, pesticides, seed and fuel for their rice crop. This loan will help them to increase their crop revenue.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seed and fuel.

loans.name: Malkay 2 Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is a resident of Malkay, a remote village in district Gujranwala in Pakistan. Like the majority of village community residents, agriculture is his sole source of income. 

Rice and wheat are the main cash crops of the region cultivated by these farmers in Malkay 2 Group. However, lack of funds to finance the required agricultural inputs often hamper their per acre production. To overcome this problem and increase their production of rice in this season, all the group members are requesting a loan to procure agricultural supplies for their rice crop. This loan will help them to improve their farm productivity and be able to send their children in school. They are grateful to lenders and promise to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seed and fuel.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Activas  es un grupo nuevo, donde todas están contentas por formar parte de este programa para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. 
Una de las personas que integra este grupo es Eduarda, quien hace y vende comidas, que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que poco a poco se ha abierto camino por medio de su esfuerzo y lucha.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar carne, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Mujeres Activas is a new group, where everyone is happy to be part of the agenda of improving the living conditions for them and their loved ones.

One of the people who makes up this group is Eduarda. She makes food, which she sells later as a street vendor. She is a hard-working woman who, little by little, has paved the way through her efforts and hard work.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, baked goods, among other things, so that she can continue working as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, baked goods, among other things.

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is the leader of a group. He lives in village Qila Mustfa abad, located in Province Punjab in Pakistan. He cultivates rice, wheat and vegetables for the livelihood of his family. He has been in this business for 20 years. He buys his supplies in the local market.

With the loan he requests, Muhammad and his group members plan to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizer, seeds, pesticides and fuel for their rice crops. Muhammad would like to use his profits to expand his business. He also plans to encourage his children to study for as long as possible.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, fuel, etc.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a 34-year-old married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and their three children who are still studying. 

Leila seeks to manage her family’s affairs and to cover her children’s education fees with the cooperation of her husband who owns a butcher shop. In 2009, she opened a coffee shop in her town. She has so far her loyal customers, who always meet at her place to have fun. 

With the requested loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she would like to purchase a new landline and a handset. One of her greatest dreams is to save enough money to provide her children with anything that they need.

loans.use: to purchase a new landline and a handset

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras  está en su ciclo número 18º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ellas están mejorando.
Fidelina es una de las que integra este grupo, es la presidenta de este comité y comenta que siempre pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder sobresalir y ayudar a su familia y ser ejemplo para sus compañeras. Ella se dedica a la costura, hace todo tipo de trabajos, y comenta que con ello tiene los ingresos para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, botones, y otros productos para poder seguir con sus confecciones, cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes. Todas están agradecidas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Emprendedoras is in its 18th loan cycle of the communal bank programme for women, where they all work and help each other to improve their situation. These women are improving through effort, constant work and the implementation of actions typical of successful women.

Fidelina is one of the members of this group and the president of this communal bank. She says that she is always doing her best to be able to stand out, help her family and be an example for her colleages. She works as a dressmaker and does all kind of works. She says that with this work she obtains the income she needs to help her loved ones.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons and other products so that she can continue sewing and handling the orders from her customers. They are all grateful for the opportunity they are given to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons and other products.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 48-year-old Lebanese divorced woman living with her five children, some of whom are still attending school. She has been the main income provider in her family since separation from her husband. 

She has been working from her house, vending clothing to help her family to meet the needs of life. She is talented and working in this type of business since 2009. She is well-known in her region by her good reputation. 

To better develop her work, she is requesting a second loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to buy new summer collection in order to improve her business and therefore her income.

loans.use: to buy new summer collection

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El Comité Virgen del Rosario esta en el  1er ciclo, están iniciando con muchas expectativas que quieren invertir para poder tener más ingresos en la casa y así  poder salir de la pobreza. 
Shirley es una de las mujeres que integra este grupo, ella se dedica a vender prendas variadas, y por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Shirley es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Ellas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Rosario communal bank is in its first season. They are starting off with many hopes, and they want to invest in order to have more income in their homes, so they can escape poverty.

Shirley is one of the women who makes up this group. She sells various articles of clothing as a living, and due to her sales, she has the means to be able to help her loved ones. Shirley is a very hard-working woman who strives to be able to improve her and her family's living conditions.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy jeans, t-shirts, blouses, pants, among other things, so that she can continue with her sales just as she has been doing.

The women are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving to be able to grow and move forward.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, blouses, pants, and other articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en: Souad is a 62-year-old Lebanese married woman and the mother of one child. Her husband represents the main income source in the family. With the aim of helping him financially, she started working as a tailor in 2006. She is a talented person and produces different clothing designs and makes repairs as well. Today, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a new sewing machine. She tends to achieve more improvements and enhancements in her life to finally reach her goals particularly wisely.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 58 years old and she lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. Anahit, like her husband, is also employed, but she always manages to find time for being engaged in agricultural activities. On her plot of land she cultivates potatoes, beans, cucumbers and greens, and also some strawberries. She sells her farm products locally. 

As Anahit mentions, she has decided to develop her agricultural works, and for this reason she must make her plot of land safe. She will use this loan for settling fence along her orchard and her vegetable garden as well.

loans.use: to settle fence along her orchard and her vegetable garden as well.

loans.name: Marco

texts.en:
Marco is aged 35 years and he supports four children. He has been a farmer for the last three years and the business earns him KES 4,500.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to enable him to get a better harvest for family use and the surplus for sale in the market.

He plans to use the profit gained to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and educate his children to higher levels of education. His hope is to expand his agricultural sector and educate his children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to enable him to get a better harvest for family use and the surplus for sale in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sausage and  hot dogs.

loans.name: Maqsood's Group

texts.en:
Maqsood is a leader of group of four, standing in the middle, with his hand raised in the picture. He is a poor farmer from Chak Sadhoo, a village located in Pakistan. He is 54 years old and strives to increase the yield of his crops by employing an optimum mix of agricultural inputs. 

One of the biggest challenges he faces is the ability to finance the purchase of agricultural inputs. Since he has no other options, he has to rely on middlemen who pledge the farmers' upcoming crop against the loan extended and pay lower prices, compared to prevailing market rates. 

Maqsood's Group is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs which will release them from manipulation of these middlemen, allow them to sell their crops at prevailing market rates, and increase their rate of return. 

This will make Maqsood more independent and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture inputs, e.g., fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, and fuel.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Nueva Esperanza  se llama este grupo que está en su ciclo número 1° del programa de comité de mujeres, está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para ir mejorando las condiciones de vida de sus familias y la de sus seres queridos.
 Todas ellas quieren ayudar a sus familias, y entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Deisy, quien se dedica a hacer y vender comida, es una mujer muy activa y trabajadora que lucha por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Deisy está contenta por formar parte del programa de comité de mujeres y de la eliminación de la pobreza, para que pueda capacitarse y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, condimentos, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo de poder crecer.
texts.en: Nueva Esperanza  (New Hope) is the name of the group that is in the 1st cycle of the women’s committee program.  They are doing the “stoplight” on poverty program survey, to learn how to improve the life conditions of their family and loved ones.  They all want to help their families.  Among them is Deisy, who prepares and sells food.  She is a very active and hardworking woman that fights to be able to improve her life conditions and help her family through her work.  Deisy is happy for being part of the women’s committee program and the poverty stoplight survey, because she can learn and get ahead.  She requests this loan to be able to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, bread and other.  This way she will be able to continue selling.  She is grateful for the opportunity to grow that they are all getting.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, bread and other products to make food for sale.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
This cheerful lady’s name is Margarita and she lives in Kapan city of the Syunik region. She is divorced and she has two daughters, both of whom are already grown-up; the elder lives and works in Yerevan and the smaller daughter is a student who also lives in Yerevan. 

Margarita, not far away from her house, has a plot of land on which she cultivates potatoes, beans, carrots, apples, apricots, mulberries, and plums. All these goods she sells locally. 

With the loan amount of 500,000 AMD (Armenian drams), Margarita wants to buy diesel fuel and seedlings for potatoes, and also she needs some money for paying for hay gathering activities, and she must also pay for mechanical service on her land.

loans.use: to pay for farm supplies, for hay gathering activities, and  for mechanical service on her land

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a 50-year-old woman. She has four children ages 18, 13, 10 and four years old. Elena’s husband is a fisherman, while she sells fish in Alegria, Cebu. She has been running this business for 10 years and has monthly earnings of PHP 5,000. She is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy fishing nets and a water engine. Elena’s future plan is to be successful in her business as well as in her own family.

loans.use: to  buy fishing nets and a water engine.

loans.name: Aghunik

texts.en:
Aghunik is 39 years old and she lives in Varser village of the Gegharkunik region. She has a very nice farm and also a nice garden full of flowers and also fruit trees. Aghunik is married and she lives with her husband and two children, a son and a daughter. She and her husband earn their family living through farming and agricultural activities.

On the farm Aghunik has a cow, a calf, a heifer, a bull, pigs and chickens. The assortment of her farm products includes items such as milk, meat, macun (national dairy product), cheese and eggs. Aghunik sells at the city’s wholesale market. Her vegetable and fruit garden is also a rich one and she also uses its harvest for her family. The harvest includes potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, greens and peppers, and such fruits as apples, apricots, cherries and mulberries. She also sells during the week. Aghunik likes her farming work and greatly wants to develop potato cultivation on her farm since it is rather profitable. She will use this loan for the purchase of potato seedlings, fertilizer and also some fodder for her cattle.

loans.use: to purchase potato seedlings, fertilizer and also some fodder for her cattle.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 40-year-old, married woman from Tskaltubo district. She has a pensioner husband, a student son and a kindergarten-aged daughter. The family gets social assistance from the local government for their poor living condition as they have no source of income. Marina wants to become a breadwinner and start her own business. 

All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests, because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Marina applied for the credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.

With the requested loan, Marina will purchase stock of clothing at wholesale prices and will sell it at increased prices in her community. Marina will work on private orders and generate her own income that will help her satisfy even the basic needs of the family.  Marina and her family members rely on the good will of Kiva lenders and will be grateful for the help.

loans.use: to purchase stock of clothing to start trading.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has four children. She is requesting a loan of GHS 2,000 to buy additional supplies to keep in her business, including soft drinks. 

She has been doing business for 12 years and started this business with the help of her husband. She's taking a loan from ID-Ghana to increase her income and she wants to do this business for a very long time. 

She is happy with the loan that was offered by ID-Ghana for her to have more working capital to buy more soft drinks to sell to customers. She promises to repay without trouble. This is her ninth loan cycle

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Saeed's Group

texts.en:
Saeed is the one at the middle in the photo with a hand raised. He is a 32-year-old who lives in the village Allah Ditta located in Pakistan. He is a married person and living with four family members. 

He is a progressive farmer, and for ten years, he has been cultivating his own field of rice and raising livestock. He turned to the microfinance institution JWS to purchase improved seeds and farm inputs for increasing his farm productivity and the number of livestock to raise. His wish is to be able to support himself through his business and to plan to send their children to school.

He and his group members request a loan for input supplies. The profit made from selling rice and from raising livestock enables them to cover their family expenses and to save money for their children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs, i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, fuel, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Kyrey está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Caacupé, las 18 integrantes del comité realizan muchos esfuerzos para así poder salir adelante junto con sus familias.
Hermelinda es una persona muy luchadora, que son sacrificio y esfuerzo ha ido creciendo y mejorando, ella tiene una peluquería que montó con mucho sacrificio y que hoy en día es el sostén de su familia. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, y otros productos para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Kuña Kyrey Group is in its second loan cycle in the women's bank program.  The 18 members of the group, which is in the city of Caacupé, work hard so they can get ahead with their families.

Hermelinda's a very persevering person who has grown and improved with sacrifice and effort.  She has a beauty salon that she opened with a lot of sacrifice, and now it supports her family.  She's a very hardworking and persevering woman who wants to get ahead so she can help her family and loved ones.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy dyes, creams, shampoo, conditioner, and other products so she can continue to work, just as she has been doing.  She's grateful for this opportunity to be able to improve on a daily basis.

loans.use: to buy dyes, creams, shampoo, conditioner, and other products

loans.name: Carla

texts.en: Carla is is 20 years old from Moalboal, Cebu. She is a single mother to a ten-month-old baby boy. She has spent her time in barns raising hogs for a year now. Carla earns PHP 2,000 every time she sells her fattened hogs. She is asking for a loan to buy more feed for her hogs and milk for her baby. In this way, she can expect healthy and fattened hogs to negotiate and sell to the buyer. Her income will provide for her son, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs and milk for her baby.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan is 32 years old and married with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in scrap metals for so long. He is a hardworking and honest man but faces a problem of market competition. He has a dream of expanding his business and taking good care of his brothers. Allan is requesting a loan to buy hardware materials like cement and iron bars to sell.

loans.use: to buy hardware materials like cement and iron bars to sell.

loans.name: Muqbool's Group

texts.en:
Living in village Allah Ditta in Pakistan, Muqbool is 28 years old and has two children. Nowadays, he earns income to support his family condition via rice and wheat growing. 

Muqbool has been with JWS for four cycles already and repaid his loans successfully. He is leading a group of four to take a new Kiva loan. As the group leader, he will manage his loan portion to buy input supplies such as pesticide, seeds and to pay a fee for land preparation. He expects his rice plantation to have more yields and increase his ability to expand his farming.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, fuel, etc.

loans.name: Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Luchadoras está en su ciclo número 1, es un grupo nuevo donde todas luchan y se esfuerzan para poder salir adelante. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas luchan y se esfuerzan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Edilce quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de ropas que hace está esforzándose por crecer y salir adelante. Edilce comenta que por medio las capacitaciones del programa de eliminación de la pobreza quiere ir mejorando cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como ser remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo esta haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Las Luchadoras are in their first loan cycle. It is a new group where all the women are striving and making an effort to make progress. They are in the poverty elimination programme, in which everyone strives and makes an effort to make progress. 

One of the members is Edilce who, through effort and continuous work and by means of the clothing sales she makes, is striving to grow and make progress. Edilce says that she wants to keep improving every day through the training which is part of the poverty elimination programme. 

She is asking for this loan in order to buy various items of clothing to sell, such as t-shirts, jeans, shirts, trousers and other items, so that by doing this she can continue with her sales as she is doing now.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts, trousers and other items of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is from Alegria, Cebu. She is 40 years old, a married woman and has four children, two boys and two girls. Myrna’s husband is a farmer. They have had their own corn (maize) and vegetable farm for 15 years. Myrna sells vegetables from their harvest such as corn (maize), vegetables and cassava. She usually earns about PHP 10,000 per month.  Myrna is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds. In the future, she hopes to be a successful businesswoman. She also dreams for her children to finish their studies and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase timber, nails, hammers and glue for making furniture to sell to clients and meet both family and client needs.

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en:
Mkhitar lives in Kapan city of the Syunik region. For many years this man worked as a driver but now his only occupation is farming. Mkhitar lives with his disabled wife. Their three children are already married and they live with their families. This man has cows, pigs and chickens. The assortment of his farm products include items such as milk, macun (national dairy product), meat and eggs.

Mkhitar sells locally to his regular customers and also to his neighbors. He likes the work about his farm, which he manages alone slowly but very properly so that all his customers like the quality of his farm products very much. He is asking for this loan of 200,000 Armenian drams as he wants to buy animal fodder for his farm cattle and he is thankful beforehand to any Kiva lender who will help him in his request.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for his farm cattle and he is thankful beforehand to any Kiva lender

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is encouraged that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She values her store since it keeps her busy while her husband is at work. Her earnings from her store help her save for her future baby.

She hopes that she can request a 19,000 loan to help her expand her store. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda and rice noodles. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her for it enables her to save for their future.

Melanie dreams of having a bigger general store. She continuous to pray that God will soon bless them with a baby. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Erik

texts.en:
Erik is 50 years old and he lives in Yerevan city. He is married and he has a daughter and son. His daughter is already a student and his son is still school-aged. His wife is employed. Erik has higher education and he has worked in his specialty since 1988. At the local TV channel he works as a chief lighting cameraman. He is a specialist of very high qualification and at his workplace he enjoys respect and love.  His colleagues describe him as very responsible, punctual, and a little bit of a strict person, who knows his work perfectly and is ready to help anyone and anytime. 

In his free time from his work, Erik also takes orders of shooting different parties.  These can be wedding or birthday parties, and some kinds of private parties, etc. This additional source of income for his family has come to lighten a lot of financial problems and wastes. So with this loan amount, Erik wants to buy a new video camera for his second work, in order to have better results in it.

loans.use: to buy a new video camera for his second work, in order to have better results in it.

loans.name: Fauza

texts.en:
Fauza is male and married with two children all attending school and living in Kasese. He deals in the sale of various motor spare parts, working 6 days a week and 11 hours per day.

He is a hardworking, honest and competent man who also deals in farming as a source of his side income though faced with a challenge of limited capital and defaulters.

Fauza is requesting a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell to meet customers’ demands and meet his future plans of expanding the business.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Nyebbiyoona No.1-Batinli-Bimbilla Group

texts.en:
Azara is a 44-year-old hard working mother of 6 children. She lives in Batingli, Bimbilla in the Northern region of Ghana.

Azara leads a 26 member shea butter processing group called "Nyebubiyoona No.1, Batingli - Bimbilla." She is the person who carries a shea nut basin whilst standing among group mates in the group photo.

Azara and her group have been in the shea butter processing business for more than a decade now. They have requested for a loan amount of  7,800 GHS, which they would use to buy more shea nuts for processing to meet an increased demand by the local market. Azara’s share of the loan is 300 GHS. 

Azara and her group are very hopeful of making good profits from the rising demand for their products. They want to earn more income to repay this loan and grow their business, as well as support their families. Azara and "Nyebubiyoona No. 1, Batingli - Bimbilla" group thank Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more shea nuts for processing to meet an increased demand in the Ghanaian local market

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Micheal is 40 years old and a resident of Kasambya in the Rakai district,. He is married with 5 children who all attend school and he also takes care of his sister-in-law.

Micheal started his business in 2009; he is in the business of brewing local alcohol. He started this business with the aim of increasing his daily income. He is also a farmer who grows coffee on a wide ranging area. He operates a retail shop to supplement his income sources. He works 7 days of the week and 12 hours per day.

Micheal wants a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy raw materials for brewing a greater amount of alcohol. He will buy bananas and ripen them, squeeze them into banana juice and later ferment the juice into alcohol.

His customers are people from different areas of the town and his neighbors. However his challenges are competition and a lack of enough capital to expand the business.
Micheal is a hard working man who wants to see his family prosper.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, in the form of bananas, for brewing alcohol.

loans.name: Nyebbiyoona No.2 -Batinli/bimbilla Group

texts.en:
Amuhera is a 43-year-old married woman with five children living in Bimbilla in the northern region of Ghana. She is a member of a shea butter processing group called Nyebubiyoona No.2, Batingli-Bimbilla and is the woman with the pan of shea nuts in this group picture.

Amuhera has been processing shea nuts for butter for the past five years and is now working with three employees. She intends to develop her business by diversifying into buying and storing shea nuts for processing during the lean season.

Amuhera and her group have therefore requested a 7,200 GHS loan through Kiva's field partner Grameen Ghana. Her share of the loan will be 300 GHS, which she will use to buy and store nuts.

Amuhera expects to repay this loan and provide nutritious food for her children with the profits she makes from her business. She looks to Kiva lenders to support her and thanks them so dearly.

loans.use: To buy and store more nuts for processing.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is aged 31 years, married to Janet and he supports one child. He has been a carpenter for the last 10 years and the business earns him 11,000 KES per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase timber, plywood and saws for making his carpentry easier and make more furniture for sale to clients in need of such products. 

He plans to use gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sale to clients and to educate his child. His hope is to expand his business sector and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase timber, plywood and saws for making his carpentry easier and make more furniture for sale to clients in need of such products

loans.name: Espiritu Joven Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESPIRITU JOVEN” iniciará el vigésimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sofía es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de verduras, venta de zapatos, venta de coca, servicio de transporte.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sofía es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá desde hace varios años. 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The “ESPIRITU JOVEN” Communal Bank is about to start its twenty ninth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II centre. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Sofía is the President. The businesses which the members of the communal bank run are varied and among these are: selling clothing, selling vegetables, selling shoes, selling coca leaf, and transport services. The loan they are going to take out will benefit small micro businesswomen including Sofía. She says she joined Pro Mujer five years ago, entering on the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business selling vegetables. She says that she learnt this business from her mum several years ago.

The loan she is going to take out is to increase her capital to buy wholesale vegetables, which she will purchase from the wholesale saleswomen in the city of El Alto and she will later sell them at her sales point. This type of work allows her to generate an income to support her family financially, as she is married and has five children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health area and the training provided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as being honest. 

She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Charity will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a large-scale business. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a farm where she keeps cows. Her primary customers are locals. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. 

She hopes that, in the future, she will have a large scale business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is 25 years old and lives with his family. He has a business selling cellphones. Edson loves and helps his support family by giving them money.

Edson needs a loan to buy more cellphones that he will sell at many fairs around the country. He has been selling cellphones for a couple of years and he knows how to manage the business. He hopes you can help him

loans.use: to buy more cellphones to sell.

loans.name: Elias Yudan

texts.es: Elías de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con compañera de vida, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde muy joven pues su padre le enseño el oficio de agricultor, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados q se encuentran cerca de su casa y gracias a esas ventas es como logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía, así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Elías is 36 years old and lives in his own home along with his life companion. He cultivates corn and beans. As a very young man, Elías learned the farming trade from his father. He sells his products at different markets that are located near his home. Thanks to his sales, he has been able to keep up with the household expenses.

Elías is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, and other supplies so that he can improve the land that is shown in the photograph. As a result, he will be able to generate a better income.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, and other supplies so that he can improve his land.

loans.name: Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.es:
“Kuña Marangatu” está en su ciclo 8 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde ellas están luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que se encuentra en una pobreza extrema, luchando por mejorar por medio de su trabajo y de la pequeña despensa que tiene. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que está luchando por poder crecer cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, frutas, carne, lácteos, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
"Kuña Marangatu" is in its eighth cycle of the women committee program. The members are participating in poverty elimination surveys, and they are fighting to improve their quality of life and that of their loved ones. 

One of the members is Maria, who showed a poverty level within level one in her survey, which means that she is living in extreme poverty. She is fighting to move forward through her work and the small grocery store that she has. She is a very hard-working woman who is making an effort to grow every day.

She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, fruits, meat, dairy products, baked goods, and other supplies in order to continue with her sales. All of the women are thankful for the opportunity that they are receiving to improve their life conditions through this loan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meat, dairy products, baked goods, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase timber and a hacksaw to make his carpentry easier and to make more furniture for sale to clients in need of such products.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a farm where she keeps cows. Her primary customers are locals. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 5,000 loan to buy gutters to enable her to harvest rainwater. 

She hopes that, in the future, she will have a large scale business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy gutters to enable her to harvest rainwater

loans.name: Duke

texts.en:
Duke is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as patient. 

He operates a farm where he keeps cows. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are locals. He says his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. 

He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy poultry. 

His business goal is to have all types of farm animals within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Arise And Shine Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group and are on their fifth loan cycle. They are requesting a total loan amount of GHS 4,000 to expand various businesses. They are very hardworking women and believe this loan will help them take care of their families. They are into tiger nuts, dough nuts and secondhand clothing. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.
 
One member of the group is Millicent, who makes a living selling tiger nuts and dough nuts. Millicent wants to get ahead and is sacrificing certain things in order to have a better quality of life for her family and her loved ones. She is applying for this loan in order to buy tiger nuts and dough nuts to continue with her sales. She can then fight for a higher income to give to her family and loved ones.

loans.use: to buy tiger nuts and dough nuts to continue with her sales.

loans.name: Nyantwire Farmers' Gp Group

texts.en:
Shown with her hand raised, Grace is a 33-year-old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells fresh produce and also has a rental business that adds to her income. Transportation costs hinder her ability to expand her business.

As leader of this group, Grace is applying for a 9,950,000 UGX loan through Kiva's field partner HOFOKAM to be apportioned among its members. She will use her share to buy more tomatoes, oranges and passion fruit to sell.

Grace’s ambition is to expand her produce business into new areas.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, oranges and passion fruit to sell.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is a 44-year-old, single woman from Kutaisi city. She has a pensioner father and is the only breadwinner in the family. Nona works hard to make financial stability for her family and serves clients as a waiter at the local restaurant. She gets a fixed salary that is hardly enough to cover all the daily costs, and she requires an additional source of income. 

The Startup program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Nona to get a loan of 1,500 Georgia Lari (GEL) and to start a trading business. She will purchase stock of merchandise such as clothing and kitchen utensils. 

Nona thinks that the business will be profitable, as she has many acquaintances and will sell the products with price mark-ups. With the support of the Startup program, Nona will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and to tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: To start trading with clothing and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Tsui-Shitsoo Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Tsui-shitoo and are two women who are both merchants and live in the same neighborhood. They sell smoked fish, cloth, materials and lace. 

Grace, age 55, is the group's representative. She's married and the mother of one child. She's a merchant with more than nine years of experience in the field. She displays her products by distribution to her customers. With this loan, she intends to buy more wax-prints, materials and lace which she will distribute to customers. 

Her profits enable her to save money with ID-Ghana, pay her child's school fees, and also take care of her household expenses. She and the other members will need a total amount of 3,000 Ghana Cedi (GHS) in their eight-loan cycle to expand their businesses. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more wax-prints, materials and lace which she will distribute to customers.

loans.name: Sinan's Group

texts.en:
A woman living in Siem Reap province, Sinan is 45 years old and a mother of three dependent children, two of whom are still in school.

She struggles to make a living via rice cropping to earn the main income of her family. Sinan also raises pigs to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 26,600 KHR per day. Her rice hardly grows better as there is insufficient water supply in the field.

To save her endangered business, Sinan decided to apply for loan support. This will be her seventh loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans as well. With her past loans, she got a decent income to support her farming and support her children’s educations.

Sinan now leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income to renovate her house and buy more fertilizers to support her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Prasat Bakong district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs and hire labour.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишеру из района Дж. Руми 37 лет. Он прекрасный человек, хороший муж  и любящий отец своим детям. Алишер уже второй год занимается разведением и куплей продажей скота. Он научился этому от своего отца. В этом не легком труде его всегда поддерживает жена, так как для них это единственный источник дохода. Алишер обратился за кредитом, чтобы закупить мелко рогатый скот. Также Алишер хочет построить специальный загон, для размещения животных, а на оставшиеся средства закупить необходимые корма для них.
texts.en: Alisher is from the J. Rumy region. He is 37 years old. He is a wonderful person, a good husband, and a loving father to his children. Alisher is in his second year of rearing and buying/selling livestock. He learned how to do this from his father. His wife always supports him in this difficult work, since it is their sole source of income. Alisher has applied for a loan in order to buy some sheep and goats. Alisher also wants to build a special animal holding pen, and with the remaining funds to buy the feed necessary for them.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock and feed, and to build a pen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken mash and other feed for his poultry.

loans.name: Tweyombeke Munteme Group

texts.en:
Dickson is a member of Tweyombeke Munteme Group. He is a very hard working man who lives in Hoima, Uganda. He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling maize, beans, and g nuts (peanuts), in order to supplement his incomes. He also farms, mainly growing maize and beans.

Dickson intends to grow and expand his business more. However, inadequate capital poses a strong threat to the achievement of his desires, on top of constant changes in weather. He will use the loan facility to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Baluku

texts.en:
Baluku is 39 years old and married with seven children, and he lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has owned a general merchandise retail shop for nine years.

Baluku began the business in order to provide basic needs for his family. He still dreams of growing his business into a wholesale business, but he is faced with the challenges of limited income and high transport costs.

He is a hard-working man and is requesting a loan to buy sugar, millet flour, rice, beans, maize flour, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, millet flour, rice, beans, maize flour, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Qila Mustafa Abad 3 Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is a group leader. He is raising his hand in the photo. He is a married, 47-year-old farmer and has 8 family members. He has been in this profession for the last 25 years. He has 7 acres of agri land where he grows wheat, rice and vegetables to feed his family.

He has gone through successful training on modern agri techniques on the plate farm of his lender to increase his yield. He and his group members are requesting a loan to purchase 10 bags of quality seeds, 45 bags of fertilizer and 18 boxes of pesticides for their rice crop. This loan will improve their income. Muhammad is dreaming to get better food and a good house for his family. 

They are committed to repaying their loan.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel, etc.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 32 years old, married with four children, and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy sand and cement to plaster his house.

Stephen operates a retail shop of general merchandise to earn a living. He has a dream of extending his business into wholesale. However, he faces challenges of high transport costs, market competition, and inadequate capital.

Stephen is a hardworking man who will use the loan to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Tanazio

texts.en:
Tanazio is a 28 year old hard working young man with 2 children. He is a farmer mainly growing tomatoes and vegetables for commercial purposes.

Tanazio has a dream of being a model farmer in his area though he is faced with the challenge of pests and disease plus weather changes. He is requesting a loan to buy pesticides and pay for labour on his farm.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and pay for labour on his farm.

loans.name: Franco

texts.en:
Franco is a 25-year-old married man with five children, including twins, and he lives in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a general merchandise shop and earns additional income from electrical installations.

He is looking forward to improving his living standards and paying school fees for his children. Despite everything, he is faced with poor climatic conditions, like heavy rainfall, and limited capital. He intends to use the loan to buy salt, rice, soap, and other merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy salt, rice, soap, and other merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 34 год, вдова, одна воспитывает 3 дочерей. У нее - высшее образование, работает учителем. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,900 сом (KGS). Динара решила отремонтировать свой дом и провести санотехнические работы, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку кафеля, ванны, обоев. Свои доходы она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Dinara is 34 years old. She is a widow, and is raising three daughters on her own. She has a higher education and works as a teacher. Her monthly income is 10,900 som (KGS). Dinara has decided to repair her house and carry out plumbing work and so she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy tiles, a bath, and wallpaper. She plans to invest her income in further improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her house, as well as a bath and tiles for her bathroom.

loans.name: Aichurok

texts.ru: Айчурок, 48 лет, замужем, многодетная мать, имеет 5 детей. Дети и супруг помогают по хозяйству. Айчурок занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 8,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее упорству она достигла хороших результатов и на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется: 2 коровы, 2 лошади. На 1,48 Га земли она выращивает ячмень. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Айчурок обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом(KGS) на покупку овец для откорма на пастбище и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита она планирует в будущем направить на покупку грузового автомобиля.
texts.en: Aichurok is 48 years old, married, and mother to five children. Her children and husband help her on the farm. Aichurok rears animals and grows crops, having started this business with 8,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her perseverance she has achieved good results and today she has two cows and two horses. She grows barley on 1.48 hectares of land. In order to increase the size of her herd, Aichurok has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy some sheep for fattening in the field and resale. She plans to direct the proceeds of the loan in future towards buying a truck.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening in the field and resale.

loans.name: Oscar Ricardo

texts.es:
Oscar es un joven que actualmente tiene 22 años de edad, está feliz mente casado y vive en una comunidad del departamento de Sololá, Oscar cuenta que con la ayuda del crédito el logro remodelar su negocio y pudo entonces prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y ahora sus ingresos han mejorado, pero Oscar hasta estos días ha tenido la necesidad de un crédito para poder comprar una motocicleta y movilizarse mucho más rápido  de su casa al lugar de su negocio ya que él vive muy lejos y no consigue trasporte con facilidad.
Oscar tiene las esperanzas de contar nuevamente con el crédito para poder movilizarse mejor, para ahorrar en trasportes, pero también sueña con contar con otro negocio de barbería.
texts.en:
Oscar is a young man who is currently 22 years of age. He is happily married and lives in a community in the Department of Sololá. With the help of a loan, Oscar was able to remodel his business and provide better service to his customers. Now his income has improved.

At the moment, Oscar needs a loan in order to buy a motorcycle so that he can travel faster from his home to his place of business. He lives far away and is not able to secure rapid transportation easily. Oscar hopes to receive this new loan so that he can have a better means of traveling. This will also save him the cost of transportation fares.

In addition, Oscar dreams of opening another barber shop business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 51 years old, from the village of Jinvali. He has a wife, a daughter, and a son. 

The only person who earns income for the family's welfare is Gocha's wife. She works as a director of the local kindergarten and gets a fixed salary of 400 GEL per month. This income is insufficient for covering all family expenses. 

Gocha has a great desire to have his own business and do his bit for the family's well-being. He decided to start poultry farming and he sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get loans for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1,200 GEL for making a chicken incubator, purchasing all needed equipment, and starting poultry farming. Gocha will sell chickens at the local market and make significant income. 

The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to make a chicken incubator and generate his own business income

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is a new client in the institution who is applying for a loan of UGX 2,000,000. 

Ivan is 30 years old and single. He works with pride as a credit officer where he earns a salary. In addition to that, he is engaged in agriculture, mostly in poultry-keeping. His main challenge has been limited capital to expand his poultry farm. 

With the loan, Ivan hopes that he will be able to buy more chicks and meet the demand of his customers. This will increase his income and sustain him, along with his siblings. He thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: La Buena Nueva 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Manuela is the coordinator of the La Buena Nueva (Good New) 1 & 2 Group, which is located in the city of Samana in one of the rural areas surrounded by the waters of the Atlantic ocean. Many of the group members sell goods, such as clothing, bread, ice cream, shoes, and cosmetics.  Others sell seafood, run fried food stalls, and operate other businesses.

Manuela is a married woman and is the mother of one child.  She said that her most difficult challenge has been to have a successful business and to create changes for her family.  She sells ice cream to neighbors in her community, and this loan (her 17th) will be used to buy different equipment that she needs for her business.  

She is investing her profits to grow her business by introducing different products.  She is hoping to make her dreams come true; she hopes to have a prosperous life and a good business.  She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy ice cream.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru:
Эту прекрасную леди зовут Фарзона. Ей 34 года. Она умелая мастерица и мать четверых детей. Она замужем, но ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Экономическая ситуация в России влияет на доход ее мужа и не всегда получается отправлять необходимую сумму Фарзоне, чтобы покрыть расходы семьи. Фарзона в поддержку мужа сама дома зарабатывает и покрывает расходы детей. Она умела швея и вышивальница. Фарзона принимает заказы на шитье одежды и параллельно делает вышивки. Она любит свою работу и уже в течение 6 лет работы в этой сфере стала профи своего дела. 
 Причина обращения Фарзоны за кредитом является приобретение кондиционера и холодильника. В этом году лето стала не выносимо жарко, и находиться в квартире с детьми очень тяжело. Ко всему этому ее холодильник сломался и ей негде хранить продукты. Фарзона не видит иного пути, как обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en:
This wonderful lady is called Farzona. She is 34 years old. She is a skilled craftswoman and the mother of four children. She is married, but her husband is away working in the Russian Federation. The economic situation in Russia is affecting her husband's income and he is not always able to send the sum of money to Farzona that is necessary to cover the family's expenses. Farzona herself earns money from home in support of her husband and covers the children's expenses. She is a skilled seamstress and embroiderer. Farzona takes orders for sewing clothing and simultaneously does embroidery. She loves her work and after six years of working in this field she has become a professional in the business.

Farzona's reason for applying for a loan is acquiring an air conditioner and refrigerator. Summer this year has become intolerably hot, and it is very difficult to remain in the apartment with her children. On top of all this, her refrigerator has broken and she has nowhere to store her produce. Farzona sees no other path than to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and air conditioner.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy hair and beauty products, beauty salon equipment, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery, such as flour, yeast, butter, etc.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.en:
Isidora has wide experience in seaweed farming. She has mastered farming activities such as growing, caring, and harvesting, and earning income as well. Isidora has supported her family in doing this type of work since her husband died.  

Like a farmer, Isidora has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the cooperative for her financial needs. 

Recently, she applied for a loan of PHP 48,000 to buy building materials and paints, and to pay her workers for her house renovation.

loans.use: to buy building materials and paints, and to pay her workers

loans.name: Gnel

texts.en:
Gnel is 44 years old and with his wife, two sons, and a daughter, he lives in the village of Tsovagyugh in the Gegharkunik region. 

On his farm, Gnel has cows, bulls, pigs, and sheep. He sells a rather large amount of meat, as well as milk and an assortment of dairy products. Gnel’s vegetable garden yields a rich harvest of potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, greens, and peppers – both for his family and for selling as well. 

Gnel dreams of a farm that is bigger and richer with cattle, but still his income is too low for new purchases. He requests this loan for the purchase of fodder now in order to keep his farm cattle fed.

loans.use: for the purchase of fodder in order to keep his farm cattle fed

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a new member of Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative.  She wishes to avail the various products and services of the Cooperative. She and her husband have been full time farmers for four years. They have three children and two of them go to school. 

Recently Mary Grace ventured into a retailing business when she opened a sari-sari store for additional income. Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase bags of fertilizer for their farming acitivity. Her plan after this loan is to buy the nearby farm so that they can increase their rice production for higher profitability in preparation for their children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Ivane is a 34-year-old married man from a village called Mukhrani. He has his mother, wife and invalid sister.

Ivane was unable to start any stable job and it's already 15 years that he works as a private artisan and generates some income. However, Ivane finds it hard to meet all of his family expenses as his job is unstable and depends on private orders.

Now he needs financial support to begin agricultural activity and start cattle breeding. Ivane has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Ivane will purchase milk cows and cattle and start dairy farming.

The loan will greatly assist Ivane, and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.

loans.use: to begin agricultural activity and start cattle breeding

loans.name: Erika Esmeralda

texts.es:
Erika, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasdta tercer grado, está casada, su esposo realiza trabajos agrícolas y tienen 2 hijos.

Erika, se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a cuidar a sus hijos, pero también debe estar pendiente de las actividades agrícolas, ya que tienen que aprovechar la época lluviosa para sembrar granos básicos, en este tipo de trabajo se involucra su hijo mayor.

Erika, está solicitando el crédito para comprar insumos tales como herbicidas, semillas, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra, con la ayuda del crédito podrá sembrar bastante y vender una parte de la cosecha para obtener ingresos y suplir las necesidades de su familia.

Los sueños de Erika son, apoyar a sus hijos para estudien en la universidad y construir una casa porque en la que viven no es propia.
texts.en:
Erika, age 28, studied until the 3rd grade, is married and has 2 children along with her husband who works in agriculture. 

Erika does the house chores and takes care of her children. However, she also has to be aware of the agricultural activities since they have to make the most of the rainy season to plant staple grains. Her oldest son is involved in this type of work. 

Erika is requesting this loan to buy supplies, like herbicides, seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor. With the help of the loan she’ll be able to plant enough and sell part of the harvest to obtain incomes and cover the needs of her family. 

Erika’s dreams are to support her children so they can go to college and build a house of their own since they don’t own the one where they live right now.

loans.use: to buy supplies, like herbicides, seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beers and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Florencipin

texts.en: Florencipin is a businesswoman who earns income by retailing various items.  She is a full-fledged member of PMPC, a Kiva partner, and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance.  Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.  She is working to renovate her house.  She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is engaged in running a snack vending store and manages a motor cab trasportation business with her husband as one of the drivers. She has been operating her business for 25 years, and she earns a monthly net income of 12,200 PHP. 

Wilma is 65 years old and married, and she has four adult-aged children. She is from Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. 

In 2006, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. 

Wilma is requesting her 14th loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase a new motor cab for her transportation business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motor cab for her transportation business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting to earning income as well. Rosario has supported her husband in doing this type of work. 

Like a farmer, Rosario has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds which will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. 

Someday Rosario hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds which will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora has mastered her food vending business in Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family.

When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. Just as she takes care of her business, so it goes with her membership in PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so that she can always access financing when she needs it.

Now, the loan of PHP 20,000 will help her to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Vergilio

texts.en:
Vergilio is a businessman who earns through hog raising. He is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance.

Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. He is on his way to renovating his house. He wishes to live comfortably with his parents.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the capital she needed to start a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to her as a small-time borrower.

She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: January

texts.en:
January is 33 years old and married with five children, four of whom attend school. January owns a boutique selling items like clothes, and shoes, and earns his additional income from a farm. He works 10 hours a day and 6 days a week. 

He has hopes of expanding his business into a wholesale boutique. However, he faces challenges of limited capital and constant changes in fashions and designs in the market. He is seeking for credit to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Imeda

texts.en:
Imeda, who is 38 years old, lives in village Mukhiani. He has parents, and the family is involved in agricultural activity. They cultivate a plot of agricultural land, growing nuts and watermelon. Imeda has a great desire to make their agribusiness more productive and has requested financial support. 

After several unsuccessful attempts, Imeda applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Imeda will purchase seeds of beans and will cultivate them. Also, he plans to make an irrigation system through his land to get a more fertile harvest. 

He is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person, with a great desire to ensure his family with a good style of life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Imeda is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to expand the agribusiness.

loans.use: to cultivate beans and make an irrigation system.

loans.name: Solin's Group

texts.en:
A young woman living in Battambang province, Solin is 23 years old and a mother of two young children. Nowadays, she can earn income to support her family condition via growing cassava and rice cropping. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. 

For Solin, this is her fifth cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loan completely. With her past loan, she can get more income to update her family living in good health. In a group of two, she is the group leader. 

She will spend her loan portion to buy seed and pay for plowing fees for her farmland. She hopes that she can get more income to buy more land to support her farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pay for plowing fees for her farmland.

loans.name: Sareuy's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Banteay Meanchey province, Sareuy is 49 years old and a mother of three children. For her family, she grows garlic and vegetables as the main source of income. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. 

This is the first loan for Sareuy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer to support her garlic farm. She hopes that she can get more income from her farm to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to support her garlic farm.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Salorn's Group

texts.en:
Salorn, 37 years old, lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of five children, three of whom are in school and other two are too young. 

She earns income to support her family via rice cropping on 2 1/2 hectares. Moreover, she can get more income via fish-catching. Her rice was destroyed by insects, so she get little yield from her farm. This is first time for Salorn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will manage her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farming. She hopes that she can get more income to support on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.en: Eulogio is a senior citizen and he gets a retirement payment every month. He is paying rent and he has a daughter. At this time he needs a loan to buy medicines and to pay for physiotherapy treatment, because he had a hip surgery recently.  He wants to recover as fast as possible, because he is in pain that is the consequence of the surgery.  So Eulogio hopes you can help him again.

loans.use: to buy medicines and to pay for physiotherapy treatment.

loans.name: Florido

texts.en:
Florido has broad experience in farming. He has mastered farming activities from growing and caring for his plants to harvesting and earning income as well. Florido has supported his wife by doing this type of work.

As a farmer, Florido has nurtured his membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. He knows he can always turn to the cooperative for his financial needs.

Recently, he applied a loan of PHP 20,000.00 to purchase rice seeds that will have good results, namely healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Florido hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results, namely healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Ее зовут Мавчуда. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем и воспитывает троих детей. Мавчуда дома предоставляет услуги швеи. Этим бизнесом она занялась недавно. Мавчуда всегда хотела шить, но из-за меленьких детей ей этого не удавалось. Теперь Мавчуда начала шить и имеет не много, но своих клиентов. Она просит ей помочь купить швейные принадлежности. Тогда она сможет выполнять более сложные операции и развиваться в этой сфере. Она уверена, что ее поддержат и верят в нее.
texts.en: This lady is called Mavjuda. She is 39 years old. She is married and she is raising three children. Mavjuda offers her services as a seamstress from home. She started doing this business recently. Mavjuda always wanted to sew, but she was not able to due to her small children. Now Mavjuda has started sewing and has just a few clients, but they are her own. She is asking to help her to buy sewing accessories. Then she will be able to carry out more complex operations and develop in this field. She is sure that she will be supported and that people will believe in her.

loans.use: to buy sewing accessories.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, 65, is a widow with five adult-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 21 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs.

She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren.

She already availed herself of loans previously to purchase a parcel of land on their place as a way of boosting her accumulated assets.

loans.use: to purchase a parcel of land

loans.name: Mab's Group

texts.en:
A mother of six dependent children living in Kampong Cham province, Mab is 48 years old. She earns an income via rice cropping and her husband is driver. 

The rice’s price was decreased when she got her yield, so she sold it at a low price. 

For Mab, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for land fees to support her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for land fees to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Ret, 43, lives with family members in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province and is the mother of four children. She earns income to improve her family's condition via rice cropping and working for others for a fee to supplement her income. 

For Ret, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland to increase her income. She hopes that she can get more income to support on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her farmland and increase her income.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ben's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Cham province, Ben is 35 years old and a mother of two young children. She grows cassava as her main source of income and grows rice to supplement her income. 

This is the first loan for Ben with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed and pay the plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes that she can get more income than before to expand her business bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed and pay the plowing fee for her farmland.

loans.name: José Delfín

texts.es: José Delfín, tiene la edad  de 59 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de café y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo de su cosecha, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Delfín is 59 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children, who are his greatest priority.
