He would like to use his loan to buy fertilisers and other products for growing coffee and, in order to make improvements, also to pay for labour to put these products to use and help on the plantation once the harvest is underway, and so be sure that the job is done well.

What he hopes for is to take advantage of the climate and soil of the region, which are good for this crop, and also to put into practice the experience of several years working with coffee. As well as buying the best, top-quality products so that his plantation develops well and healthily, he also wants a good crop, and to produce a significant amount in the short term.

He wants to use the income he hopes to obtain from the harvest for the wellbeing of his family and to achieve some goals in relation to them, as well as to continue investing more in his crops. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans before with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: pay for help with his coffee business.

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is 53 years old and is a married farmer. He and his wife look after of four children. He is standing in this photo and raising his hand. He is the leader of a group of four farmers. He is a resident of the village “Chak Sadhoo”, District Gujranwala, Pakistan.
He has over 25 years experience in cultivating the land. He grows rice and wheat in his fields for the living expenses of his family. He wants to better feed his children and dreams to educate them in good schools.
He is asking for the loan to buy supplies for the rice season so that with this harvest he can be sure of having money to satisfy the needs of his household as well as ensuring that he can feed his family. He has to buy 18 bags of fertilizer, 2 bags of quality rice seeds and 5 boxes of pesticides for his rice crop. His yield will increase after using these inputs. 
He hopes to have a very good harvest and hopes his children will better themselves and achieve big things in life.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en: Pablo is 32 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his parents and doesn't pay rent, but helps with the house expenses. Two years ago, he started a restaurant inside a Mexico City Market. The place is of one of his brother's, so he doesn't pay rent and has little expense. He is open everyday from 8 -18:30. He is asking for a loan to pay suppliers of his business. His goal is to grow his business.

loans.use: to pay suppliers of his restaurant (working capital).

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Она молодая девушка по имени Мухаё. Ей 27 лет. Она замужняя женщина и мать двоих детей. Мухаё вместе с семьей проживает в городе Душанбе. Муж Мухаё работает водителем, а сама Мухаё около 4 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды. Мухаё вместе с мужем решили отремонтировать дом, но их средств не хватает для совершения этой операции. Мухаё сама обратилась за кредитом, потому, что МДО Хумо поддерживает клиентов женщин и предлагает им упрощенный процесс кредитования. Вы сейчас можете поддержать семью Мухаё.
texts.en: This is a young lady by the name of Muhayo. She is 27 years old. She is a married woman and the mother of two children. Muhayo lives with her family in the city of Dushanbe. Muhayo's husband works as a driver, and Muhayo herself has been sewing women's clothing for about four years. Muhayo and her husband have decided to renovate their house, but they do not have sufficient funds to complete this operation. Muhayo has applied for a loan herself because MLO Humo supports women clients and offers them a simplified loan process. Now you can support Muhayo's family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and renovate her house.

loans.name: Abdusator

texts.ru:
Абдусаттор 33 летний житель города Душанбе. Он женат, но пока у них не получается иметь детей. Абдусаттор мечтает о детях и хочет стать примерным отцом для своих чад, чтобы они гордились им. 
Абдусаттор занимается предоставлением услуг по ремонту. Абдусаттор решил найти дополнительный источник дохода. Он собирается заняться покупкой и продажей арбузов и дыни. Сейчас самый сезон этих ягод и фруктов. В нем открылись качества продавца, и Абдусаттор считает, что может быть в будущем, он в серьез будет заниматься торговой деятельностью. Но пока он просит ему помочь купить арбузы и товары и начать торговлю.
texts.en: Abdusator is a 33-year-old resident of the city of Dushanbe. He is married, but is not yet able to have children. Abdusator dreams of children and wants to become a model father to his children so that they would be proud of him. Abdusator provides repair services. Abdusator has decided to find an additional source of income. He is preparing to buy and sell watermelon and melons. Now is the season for these berries and fruits. He has discovered the qualities of a salesman in himself, and Abdusator thinks that perhaps in future he will engage seriously in trading activity. But for now he is asking to help him buy some watermelon and other goods and to start trading.

loans.use: to buy and sell watermelon and melons.

loans.name: Dong's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Kampong Cham province, Dong is 44 years old and not yet married. 

To support her family, she sells snacks at home and grows rice to earn additional income. She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 34,100 KHR per day. Her income has been decreasing because she has to sell her rice at a low price. 

For Dong, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In this group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides to support her rice farm and to get higher yields. 

She hopes that she can gain an income higher than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides to support her rice farm and to get higher yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Yot's Group

texts.en:
A woman living in Battambang province, Yot is 41 years old and a mother of three children. For her living, she grows cassava as the main source of income. Her husband is soldier and he also works for other for a fee to earn more income. The problem that Yot got in her business, she did not have enough capital to support on her farmland. 

This is her fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans as well. For her past loan, she can get more income to update her family condition better than before. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. 

She will use her loan portion to buy cassava seed and pay for plowing fees to support her farm. She hopes that she can get more income to buy fertilizer to support her farm.

loans.use: To buy cassava seed and pay for plowing fees to support her farm.

loans.name: Vang's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Vang is 55 years old and a mother of eight children. She can earn income to support her family’s living via rice cropping and working for others for a fee to get more income. Her rice grows not well because insect has destroyed her rice. 

This is the first loan for Vang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed and pay the plowing fee to support her farmland and increase her yield. She hopes that she can earn more income to update her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed and pay the plowing fee to support her farmland and increase her yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Thouk's Group

texts.en:
Thouk is 39 years old and married with two children. They are living in a rural village of the Kampong Cham Province. Her main source of income is from raising fish, which she has been doing for 21 years. She also owns a corn and sesame farm. Her fish raising did not gain her a good income, because a lot of fish died. 

This is Thouk’s third loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loans completely. With her past loan, she made a decent income to update her living condition and keep her children in school. 

She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy seed, fish feed and pesticide to support her fish-raising and corn farm. She hopes that she can gain a better income than last year.

loans.use: to buy seed, fish feed and pesticide to support her fish-raising and corn farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: El Pozito Group

texts.es:
La cultura mazahua quedó arraigada en varias comunidades del Estado de México en donde muchos habitantes conservan su lengua y tradiciones. Dentro de estas destaca la petición de mano de las novias ya que se realiza una gran fiesta donde los padres del novio llevan ofrendas a los padres de la novia además de comida para todos los acompañantes. 
   El nopal y el maíz son los son los productos base dentro de la economía local además del comercio; muchas familias llegan a tener hasta tres negocios al mismo tiempo.  De ahí es originario el grupo El Pozito.
   Doña Hilaria forma parte del grupo, ella es una mujer ampliamente trabajadora y amable. Está casada con Pablo quien asegura ser comerciante desde que tiene uso de razón, por tal motivo Hilaria decidió integrarse a las actividades de su esposo y vender artículos para el hogar que adquiere y vende en la Ciudad de México. Su negocio ha crecido considerablemente puesto que anteriormente su puesto sólo contaba con algunos metros cuadrados y ahora suman 10. 
   Con la oportunidad del préstamo podrá comprar productos plásticos, fibras y trastes. "Por algunos meses debo quedarme en casa para estar al pendiente del cultivo del maíz" comento Doña Hilaria quien también realiza actividades del campo". La única meta que tiene en mente es conservar el negocio ya que durante muchos años ha solventado todos los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus seis hijos. 
   Todos integrantes del grupo El Pozito están muy contentos y agradecidos porque podrán invertir en sus negocios. De este modo Maricruz y Ma. de Lourdes podrán invertir en productos de jarcieria; Audifren, en cazuelas y ollas; Celia, en abarrotes y Juana, en bolsas y cerillos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de Doña Ma. Lourdes quien viste pantalón rosa. Doña Hilaria por su lado viste una falda a cuadros*
texts.en:
Mazahua culture has remained rooted in several communities in the state of Mexico, where a lot of residents preserve their language and traditions.  Among these, asking for a young woman's hand in marriage stands out because there's a big party where the parents of the groom take offerings to the parents of the bride in addition to food for all the attendants.  Prickly pear and corn are the basic products in the local economy, in addition to commerce.  A lot of families even have three businesses at the same time.

El Pozito Group is from that area.  Hilaria belongs to the group.  She's a thoroughly hardworking and pleasant person.  She's married to Pablo, who claims to have been a merchant as long as he has been able to think.  That's why Hilaria decided to join her husband's work and sell household items, which she acquires and sells in Mexico City.  Her business has grown considerably because previously she only had a few square meters in her stall and now she has ten.

The loan will give her the opportunity to buy plastic products, thread, and dishes.  "I have to stay at home for a few months to take care of the corn crop," Hilaria said.  She also has some farming tasks.  Hilaria's only goal is to preserve her business, because for many years she has paid all the household expenses and the educational expenses of her six children.

All the members of El Pozito Group are very happy and grateful because they'll be able to invest in their businesses.  So Maricruz and Ma. de Lourdes will be able to buy rope products; Audifren, pots and pans; Celia, groceries; and Juan, bags and candles.

The photograph was taken on the patio of Ma. Lourdes, who is wearing pink pants.  Hilaria's wearing a plaid skirt.

loans.use: to buy plastic products, thread, and dishes

loans.name: Tamarindo Group

texts.es:
En territorio oaxaqueño se localiza una comunidad que tiene como símbolo de identidad una gran presa que es un gran apoyo para la actividad económica del lugar. La mayoría de los habitantes pescan en sus aguas y cocinan el producto de distintas y deliciosas maneras. En dicha comunidad se integró el grupo Tamarindo; ellos tienen buenas referencias pues han sabido cumplir con sus actividades y obligaciones financieras. Los integrantes son: Cristina quien venden comida; Juana, Menelick, Saturnina y José, pescado; Matilde, ropa y, por su parte, Ignacio maneja una papelería y Thalía cría animales de corral. 
   Thalía es la más joven de la agrupación pero no por ello la menos trabajadora y alegre. Desde hace 6 años Talí, como le conocen en la localidad, se dedica a la cría de borregos, actividad que aprendió gracias a sus padres.  Con las ganancias obtenidas espera construir un corral más amplio para incrementar la producción ya que debido a las fiestas de clausura muchas familias comprarán borregos para sus banquetes. “Mi sueño es tener una granja, pues en la región hay muy pocas personas que se dedican a esta actividad, además quiero enseñar todo a mi hijo” comenta. Aunado a esto, actualmente se desempeña como profesor comunitario con el fin de obtener una beca para así poder estudiar una licenciatura en administración. Ahora bien, el préstamo anterior lo invirtió en la compra de alimento, pero en esta ocasión lo utilizaría para comprar una ejemplar hembra. 
   El grupo Tamarindo está agradecido infinitamente con VisionFund México y KIVA por las oportunidades de crecimiento que brindan a todos los clientes, dado que con las ganancias mejoran la calidad de vida de las familias.

*En la fotografía se aprecia a los integrantes del grupo Tamarindo, Tali es quien viste  blusa color rojo y porta una valeriana café.
texts.en:
In the Oaxaca territory there is a community which has as its identity symbol a large dam which is a great support for the economic activity in the area. The majority of inhabitants fish in its waters and cook the catch in different and delicious ways. In this community the Tamarindo group was formed. They have good references since they have been able to fulfil their activities and financial obligations. The members are: Cristina who sells food; Juana, Menelick, Saturnina and José who sell fish; Matilde who sells clothing while Ignacio runs a stationery shop and Thalía raises farmyard animals. 

Thalía is the youngest of the group but by no means the least hard-working and happy. For 6 years Talí, as she is known locally, has made a living raising sheep, a skill which she learnt with the help of her parents. With the profits she has made she hopes to build a bigger pen to increase her production because for the graduation parties lots of families will buy lambs for their banquets. "My dream is to have a farm, because in the area there are very few people working in this activity, and I want to teach my son everything" she says. 

On top of this, she is currently working as a community teacher with the aim of getting a grant so she can study for a degree in administration. Having said that, she used the previous loan to buy feed, but on this occasion she will use the loan to buy a female sheep. 

The Tamarindo group is infinitely grateful to VisionFund Mexico and Kiva for the opportunities for growth which they provide to all their clients, given that with the profits they improve the families' quality of life.

In the photograph you can see the members of the Tamarindo group. Talí is the one dressed in the red top and wearing a brown hair band.

loans.use: to buy a female sheep.

loans.name: Thon's Group

texts.en:
A mother of eight dependent children living in Kampong Cham province, Thon is 46 years old. 

She grows rice as her main source of income and catches fish to supplement her income. 

For Thon, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In this group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy a boat and fish net to support her fish-catching. 

She hopes that she can earn more income to update to a better lifestyle and to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a boat and fish net to support her fish-catching.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sok Cheoun

texts.en:
Sok Cheoun, 31, lives with family members in a rural area of Kratie province. She is a mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school, while the other one is too young. 

She can earn income to improve her family’s living via pig-raising. Moreover, she can earn more income via rice cropping (on one hectare area) and fish-catching. Her income was decreasing because her pigs got ill. 

This is the fifth cycle for Sok Cheoun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. Because of her past loan, her family’s living has improved gradually from before. She will use her entire loan portion to buy more pigs and pig feed to support her pig-raising. 

She hopes that she can earn more income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and pig feed to support her pig-raising.

loans.name: Chhunteng's Group

texts.en:
A mother of three children living in Kampong Cham Province, Chhunteng is 34 years old. Nowadays, she grows rice as her single source of income. Her rice does not grow well, because it was destroyed from mice and insects. 

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan completely. With her past loan, she has been able to update her family’s living better than before. 

She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to support her rice farming. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland to bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to support her rice farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sithorn's Group

texts.en:
Sithorn, 36, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham Province. She is a mother of three children; two who are in school and the other one is too young. She can earn income to support her family condition via rice cropping and car repair. Her rice was destroyed by insects and mice, so she did not get good yield. 

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan as well. With her past loan, she earned more income to improve her family’s living, better than before. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will manage her entire loan portion to buy car equipment to support her car repair business. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her business larger than before.

loans.use: to buy car equipment to support her car repair business.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Roma Group

texts.es:
En un poblado veracruzano donde la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a realizar labores del campo y su símbolo de identidad es la cordialidad se consolidó el grupo Roma. El nombre fue elegido debido ya que, para los miembros, dicha ciudad representa un símbolo de grandeza, fuerza y trabajo ya que como dice el dicho “Roma no se hizo en un día”. Los integrantes son: Maricela quien vende zapatos; Matilde, comida y antojitos; Norberta, ropa interior; Arnulfo, refresco y Margarita, artículos de plata y tamales. Por su lado Ana maneja una repostería y Evarista una carnicería. 
   Doña Matilde es una mujer muy trabajadora, que a pesar de haber enviudado desde hace 7 años se ha esforzado por brindarle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo que ahora tiene 10 años. Para solventar sus necesidades inició a vender comida típica ya que esta actividad le permitía trabajar desde casa y no descuidar a su pequeño. Desde entonces coloca todos los días frente a su casa una mesa donde acomoda los ingredientes necesarios para elaborar los alimentos. Los fines de semana prepara tamales pues tiene clientes que desde muy temprano desean disfrutar de su delicioso sabor.
   Con las ganancias obtenidas puede invertir en la educación de su hijo además de cubrir con los gastos regulares del hogar. Doña Mati, como es mejor conocida, empleará el préstamo en la compra de pasta, mayonesa, queso, col, pollo, cueritos, jamón, media crema y servilletas, pues los fines de semana vende más sobre todo ahora que los alumnos de la comunidad se encuentran en periodo de vacaciones.
 “Gracias por esta oportunidad que nos brindan ya que es de suma importancia para nuestras actividades.” comentó Mati.
*La fotografía fue tomada frente a la casa de Doña Mati donde se puede ver su pequeño puesto, ella es quien tiene un “chicharrón” en las manos.
texts.en:
The Roma Group was formed in a village in Veracruz, in which the majority of the inhabitants work in farming, and the defining characteristic is cordiality. The group's name was chosen because, for its members, this city is a symbol of grandeur, strength and labor, as in the phrase "Rome was not built in a day". The members are: Maricela, who sells shoes; Matilde, meals and snacks;  Norberta, underwear; Arnulfo, soft drinks; and Margarita, silverware and tamales. Ana runs a confectioner's shop, and Evarista a butcher shop. 

Matilde is a very hard-working woman. When she was widowed 7 years ago she struggled to provide the best for her young son, who is now 10 years old. In order to pay her bills she started selling traditional meals, which allowed her to work from home and not leave her child. Since then she has put out a table in front of her house with the ingredients needed to make her food. On weekends she makes tamales, because she has customers who want to enjoy their delicious flavor starting very early. With her earnings she can pay for her son's education as well as her regular household expenses. Mati, as she is called, will use the loan to buy pasta, mayonnaise, cheese, cabbage, chicken, pork rinds, ham, table cream and napkins. On weekends she sells more, because the local students are on vacation. "Thank you for this opportunity that you are providing to us, because it is very important for our businesses", she says. 

*The photograph was taken in front of Mati's house, where you can see her small food stall. She is the one who has a pork crackling in her hands.

loans.use: to buy pasta, mayonnaise, cheese, cabbage, chicken, pork rinds, ham, table cream and napkins.

loans.name: Narom's Group

texts.en:
A woman living in Kampong Cham Province, Narom is 34 years old and a mother of four dependent children. She struggles with her family’s hardship via growing cassava and rice cropping to supplement her income. Her cassava did not produce a good yield, so she sold it at a low price. 

This is first time for Narom with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seeds and to pay for labor fees to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get more income than before.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor fees to support her cassava farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: Pov is a 35-year-old mother of three schoolchildren living in Mondulkiri province. She grows cassava as her main source of income. She earns additional income working for others for a fee. Her cassava business earns her minimal income because crops have not grown well. For Pov, this is her second loan  with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her first. In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will manage her loan portion to buy pesticide to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get more income than before to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy pesticide to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Saroeun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham Province, Saroeun is 52 years old and a father of five children. For his business, he grows cassava as his main source of income and sells rice bran (pig feed) to earn more income. His cassava does not grow well and he sells it for a low price. 

For Saroeun, this is his fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has fully repaid his past loans. With his past loan, he saved his money to update his business as well. 

He leads a group of six members to get a new loan. As the group leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy more land and seed to support his cassava farm. He hopes that he can get more income to support his living condition better than before.

loans.use: to buy more land and seed to support his cassava farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Dario

texts.es: Darío es un agricultor de la comunidad de Intibucá, Honduras; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y café desde hace 26 años; su esposa Luisa se dedica al cultivo de fresas con lo cual también aporta para los gastos del hogar. Ellos luchan juntos para dar un mejor bienestar a sus cuatro hijos, dos de los cuales todavía están en la escuela. Una de sus mayores aspiraciones es poder contar con servicio de energía eléctrica, pero la comunidad donde ellos viven no tiene acceso al sistema de energía pública por lo que Darío está solicitando financiamiento a Soluz Honduras  para la compra de un Sistema Solar para el hogar y de esa manera mejorar en gran medida las  condiciones de su familia y de su actividad agrícola ya que esto le permitirá tener más tiempo para hacer una mejor preparación del grano y obtener  una cosecha con mayor calidad.
texts.en: Darío is a farmer in the community of Intibucá, Honduras. He has been dedicated to the cultivation of corn and coffee for 26 years. His wife Luisa cultivates strawberries which also contributes to household expenses. Together they strive to provide the best well-being to their four children, two of whom are still in school. One of their greatest aspirations is to have electricity service but the community where they live is without access to a public power system which is why Darío is requesting financing from Soluz Honduras to buy a Solar System for his home. In this way, he will greatly improve the conditions of his family and of his farming since this will allow him more time to make a better preparation of the grain and obtain a higher quality harvest.

loans.use: to buy a solar system which will be of great benefit to his home and farm.

loans.name: Yadira Judith

texts.es:
YADIRA TIENE 25 AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERA VIVE EN CASA PROPIA, EN UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA, EN EL DISTRITO DE CAYALTÍ, PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGIOS LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERÚ.

ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA EN GENERAL, EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO Y VISITANDO A SUS CLIENTE HACE APROXIMADAMENETE MAS DE 3 AÑOS, CUENTA CON MUY BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES. SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCADERÍA PARA AUMENTAR EL STOCK DE SU NEGOCIO Y ASÍ HACERLO CRECER, LO QUE LE GENERARÁ MAYORES INGRESOS Y DE ESTA MANERA PODRÁ MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA Y LA DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Yadira, age 25, is single.  She lives in her own house in a community that devotes itself to commerce, agriculture, and livestock.  It is in the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She has been selling general clothing at her house and by visiting her customers for over three years approximately.  She has very good personal and work references.  

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise to increase the stock in her business and to make it grow this way.  This will generate greater earnings.  This way she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in order to increase the stock in her business.

loans.name: Faafiu

texts.en: Faafiu is 45 years old and married with five children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for six years. Faafiu has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter.

loans.name: Sokhat's Group

texts.en: Sokhat is a 23-year-old married man living in Mondulkiri province. He earns income to support his family by growing cassava and working for others for a fee. He has been involved in farming for two years and it earns him about 36,200 KHR per day. Sokhat’s cassava farm has not produced a good yield because of drought. This is his second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has fully repaid back his first loan successfully. He leads a group of four to apply a new loan. As the group leader, he will use his entire loan portion to buy seed and pay for labor to cut the grasses on his farm. He hopes that he can get more income to upgrade his living standard.

loans.use: To buy seed and pay for labor to cut the grasses on his farm.

loans.name: Samai's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Mondulkiri province, Samai is a 30-year-old mother of four children, one of whom is in school, while the others are yet too young to attend. To support her family Samai grows cassava as her main source of income, but also works for others to supplement her income. Involved in her business for five years, she can save about 33,900KHR per day. Her main problem is the insect infestation that destroyed much of her cassava crop.

Having repaid her previous loan, Samai, now leading a group of three, is requesting her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to buy pesticide and pay for labor fees to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get a high yield from her farm to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and pay for labor fees to support her farmland.

loans.name: Argentina

texts.es: Doña Argentina de 68 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de maletines de diferentes tamaños desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus producto en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de telas, etc. todo por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Argentina, age 68, lives in her own house with her daughter.  She has been making and selling different sizes of luggage for 20 years.  She sells her products at the different markets that are close to her house.  With the sales that she makes, she manages to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy thread, needles, and a variety of fabrics, etc. in bulk.  She will do this in order to continue with her work.  This way she will be able to get improved earnings.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, and a variety of fabrics, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Futuro Para El Bien Group

texts.es: Eugenia es una mujer emprendedora de 59 años de edad,viuda que ha sabido salir adelante para sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos trabajando en la venta de abarrotes desde hace 16 años del cual se siente orgullosa por sus logros,su mayor obstáculo fue la perdida de su esposo que la llevó a una fuerte depresión, pero gracias a gente amiga que la apoyo en esos momentos difíciles la invito a ingresar al banquito donde lleva 7 años dentro del grupo en el cual se siente muy satisfecha por que gracias al préstamo a podido ampliar su negocio en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche,aceite y mas, agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada y dice que no dejen de apoyarla,"Gracias por ayudarnos a seguir creciendo."
texts.en:
Eugenia is an entrepreneurial women, is 59 years old, and a widow. She has known how to get ahead in order to help her 4 children get ahead by selling groceries for 16 years. She feels proud of her achievements. Her biggest obstacle was the death of her husband which made her go through a deep depression. But, thanks to friends who supported her during those difficult times, she was invited to join the communal bank where she has spent 7 years with the group. 

She feels very satisfied because, thanks to the loan, she has been able to grow her business by purchasing staples such as rice, sugar, milk, oil and more. She appreciates the Kiva lendors for their help and says to not stop supporting her, "Thanks for helping us continue to grow."

loans.use: to buy groceries such as sugar, rice, oil, milk, and more.

loans.name: Glenda Yamileth

texts.es:
Glenda, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, debido a la situación económica que sus padres vivían no le fue posible continuar sus estudios, está acompañada, madre de tres hijos, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura.

Glenda  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 2 años, también tiene una pequeña venta de helado en la cual sus hijos le ayudan.

Glenda pretende invertir el crédito en compra de maíz y leña para el negocio, también mejorara la infraestructura donde elabora las tortillas, esperando prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

El sueño de Glenda es que su negocio siga creciendo, ya que con sus ingresos podrá preparar a sus hijos académicamente, y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Glenda, 38 years old, studied until the 9th grade. Due to the economic situation that her parents were living, it was not possible for her to continue her studies. She is in a relationship, mother of three children, and her partner works in agriculture. Glenda has been dedicated to making and selling tortillas for the past two years. She also has a small ice cream stand in which her children help her. 

Glenda hopes to invest the loan in the purchase of corn and firewood for her business as well as improving the infrastructure where she makes tortillas, hoping to provide a better service to her customers. Glenda’s dream is that her business keeps growing since with her income she will be able to prepare her children’s education and better her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for tortilla sales.

loans.name: Kimsean's Group

texts.en:
A widowed woman with four children living in Siem Reap province, Kimsean is 57 years old. To make a living, she has been selling groceries for 15 years, earning about 30,000 KHR per day. She also works for others to earn additional income. 

Having repaid her three previous loans from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), loans that improved her living conditions and enabled her children to attend school, Kimsean now leads a group of four requesting a new loan. She will spend her entire portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes that after she gets a new loan, she can increase her income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Banteay Srey Distrcit

loans.name: Nakry's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from Siem Reap province, Nakry is 49 years old and a mother of two dependent children. She earns income by rice cropping on two hectares of land and by fishing. She also earns income by raising pigs-and sewing clothes. The rice farm has not returned her a good yield because of drought and a lack of fertilizer. She can save from her daily income about 15,000 KHR. For Nakry, this is her fifth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid back her past loans completely. With her past loans, she has increased her income and bought decent clothes for her family. In a group of three, she is the group leader. Nakry will manage her loan portion to repair her boat and buy a fishing-net to support her fishing business, and buy fertilizer to support her farm. She hopes that she can get a better yield to increase her income so she can support her children’s education.

loans.use: To repair her boat and buy a fishing-net to support her fishing-business and buy fertilizer to support her farm.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Prasat Bakong district

loans.name: Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Estado de México es una de las entidades con mayor número de riqueza cultural debido a las diversas culturas prehispánicas que habitaron la región. Una comunidad mazahua, por ejemplo, mantiene muchas de las tradiciones originarias además de la lengua. Los habitantes dedican su trabajo al campo y la cría de ganado, también son muy amigables y aman la naturaleza. El grupo Nuestra Esperanza se integró en dicha comunidad y el nombre se refiere a la ilusión que tienen sus miembros por mejorar sus negocios. 
   Ana Isabel es una mujer muy responsable, siempre procura lo mejor para sus hijos en especial para los tres que continúan sus estudios. Ana, como le dicen de cariño, proviene de una familia numerosa; su mamá se dedicó a la elaboración de conserva de frutas y de ella aprendió el valor del trabajo. Actualmente Ana se dedica a la fabricación de piel al igual que sus demás hermanos. De igual forma, decidió seguir los pasos de su madre y ahora realiza conservas con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos. El proceso de elaboración le toma una semana, y una vez listas las vende en ferias, de casa en casa o incluso los clientes van hasta su domicilio debido a su calidad. En cuanto a la cría de borregos, necesita comprarlos desde pequeños para asegurar su óptimo desarrollo, después los vende sin contratiempos pues ya tiene clientes seguros gracias a sus 14 años de experiencia. 
   Ana comenta que "la cría de animales es un negocio muy rentable, la fabricación de conservas es más complicada debido al precio de la materia prima pero todo el esfuerzo vale cuando se ve el resultado". Ella está muy agradecida con VisionFund por la ayuda obtenida, con la oportunidad del préstamo podría invertir en la compra de fruta y borregos. El sueño de Ana, además de poder dar empleo a otras personas, es mejorar su calidad de vida y poder dar estudios a sus hijos. 
   Las otras integrantes del grupo son Ma. Elena quien invertirá en becerros; Avelina, en cerdos y  Patricia al igual que Elvia invertirán en borregos. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del kiosco municipal, Ana es quien viste el chaleco color rosa*
texts.en:
The State of Mexico has a great amount of cultural wealth due to the various pre-Hispanic cultures that have inhabited the region. One such community is the Mazahua. For example, they have been able to preserve many of their original traditions, as well as their language. The residents earn their living in the fields and by raising livestock. They are extremely friendly and have a love of nature. The group “Nuestra Esperanza” (Our Hope) is part of this community. The name refers to the dream that many of the members have to improve their businesses.

Ana Isabel is a responsible woman who is looking to provide the best for her children, especially that the three of them continue their studies. She says lovingly that she comes from a large family. Her mother made preserved fruit, so she learned the value of this type of work. At the moment Ana engages in making leather, the same trade as her brothers. However, she also continues to follow in the footsteps of her mother and still makes preserves in order to improve her income. The process of making preserves takes a week. Once the products are ready they are sold at the fairs, by going door-to-door, or as a result of customers who come to her home because of the quality. Ana also raises sheep, so she needs to buy small lambs to ensure that they develop properly. She sells them without any problems and has accumulated regular customers thanks to her 14 years of experience.

Ana says, “Raising animals is very profitable business, but making preserves is more complicated because of the price of the supplies. However, it is worth all of the effort when you see the results.” She is extremely grateful to VisionFund for the assistance she has obtained. With this loan opportunity, she will be able to invest in the purchase of fruit and sheep. Among Ana’s dreams are to provide jobs to other people, improve her quality of life, and provide for her children’s education.

The other group members are Ma. Elena who will invest in calves, Avelina who will buy pigs, Patricia who will also buy pigs, and Elvia who will invest in calves.

*The photograph was taken on the steps of the municipal kiosk. Ana is shown wearing a pink vest.

loans.use: to buy fruit and sheep.

location.town: La Purisima Concepcion Mayorazgo, San Felipe del P

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, tiene un negocio de venta de tortas y hamburguesas desde hace 2 años tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada, la joven vive en casa propia con su madre, ella esta de crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus tortas y hamburguesas como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, entre otros ingredientes y poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en su casa con los gastos que se le puedan presentar.
texts.en:
The young women, whose face has been blurred due to her being 24 years old and living in a high-risk zone, has a shop where she has sold sandwiches and hamburgers for two 2 years. She has a good customer base since she sells her food at a good price. Her store is located close to her house in a busy area. The young women lives in her own home with her mother. 

Her loan allows her to buy everything she needs to make her sandwiches and hamburgers, like bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, and bologna, among other ingredients. She will be able to have better profits and continue helping at home with expenses that can come up.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, and bologna, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Laura Gabriela

texts.es: Laura tiene 25 años es soltera y vive en la ciudad de México. Estudio un bachillerato técnico en negocios, ella tiene un pequeño negocio en donde vende alimentos como tortas, sándwiches y comida para llevar, ella inicio este negocio porque ama cocinar, lleva dos años en este negocio además de trabajar en la recepción de un gimnasio. Ella solicita un préstamo por MXN 8000 para poder invertir en más mercancía así como hacer remodelaciones a su negocio y comprar mobiliario, ella pretende a futuro poner un paleteria, con las ganancias que le genere su negocio ella quiere estudiar una carrera universitaria, ella agradece a Konfío por la oportunidad que le están dado de creer en ella.
texts.en:
Laura is 25 years old, single, and lives in Mexico City. She is studying for a technical degree in Business and also has a small shop where she sells food such as cakes, sandwiches, and other foods that can be eaten on the go. Laura started this business because she loves to cook. She has been in this business for two years. In addition, Laura works as a receptionist at a gymnasium.

She is requesting a loan of 8,000 MXN so that she can invest in more merchandise, as well as pay for renovations to her business and obtain furnishings. In the future, she intends to open a popsicle shop. With the income she generates from her business, Laura wants to study for a university degree. She is grateful to Konfío for the opportunity she has been given in order to grow.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and to pay for renovations to her shop.

loans.name: Uaine

texts.en:
Uaine is a 24-year-old, unmarried woman with three children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Uaine needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Uaine has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates.

loans.name: Lemalie

texts.en:
Lemalie is a humble, 43-year-old unmarried woman with six children. She runs a small food stall in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Lemalie needs a loan to buy two large ovens, new pots, foil, trays, taro, bananas and breadfruit. She plans to use her profits to support her family and secure the future of her children. Lemalie has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy two large ovens, new pots, foil, trays, taro, bananas and breadfruit.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
A resident of Takeo province, Keo, aged 53, is the mother of four children. She earns income to support her family’s living costs via rice cropping on two hectares. She has been involved in her business for many years and, through this, she earns 9.03 USD per day. 

For Keo, this is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has completely repaid her previous loan. Through her previous loan, she could earn more income to improve her family's living conditions and to keep her children at university. She will use this loan to pay the tuition fees for her son's studies to increase his general occupational skills. She hopes that he will get a good job after he has graduated.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fees for her son's studies to increase his general occupational skills.

loans.name: Tuaoi

texts.en:
Tuaoi is a 58-year-old, widow with three children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Tuaoi has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material.

loans.name: Moana

texts.en:
Moana is 72 years old and married with one child. She has a small business making and selling fine mats and a variety of Samoan carved crafts in her community. She has been doing this for more than 10 years. 

Moana needs a loan to buy rolls of pandanus leaves, varnish, paintbrushes, carving tools, strings and rollers. Moana will use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2005 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of pandanus leaves, varnish, paintbrushes, carving tools, strings and rollers.

loans.name: Tuloto

texts.en:
Tuloto is a kind, 45-year-old mother with one child. She owns a small peanut farm not far from her village center. She has 20 years of experience and has been quite successful throughout the years. 

Tuloto is in need of a loan to buy a new chemical mixer, a spray gun, two rakes, chicken excrement for the soil and a new wheelbarrow. Tuloto has been with SPBD for 12 years, she hopes to use her profits to support her child's education and also help with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new chemical mixer, a spray gun, two rakes, chicken excrement for the soil and a new wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Lagaau

texts.en:
Lagaau is 28 years old and unmarried with three children. 
She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Lagaau needs a loan to buy chemicals, a machete, a pitchfork, fertilizer, a spade, gloves and crops. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. Lagaau will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a machete, a pitchfork, fertilizer, a spade, gloves and crops

loans.name: Srey Ra's Group

texts.en:
Srey Ra is a 22-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is in school while the other one is too young. Currently, she lives in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. Growing rice and building ground gutters have been the main sources of her family’s income for the past 15 years. The depreciation in the market price of rice is the main challenge that Srey Ra faces in earning income to support her family. 

This is Srey Ra's third loan cycle while, for the other member of her group, it is her first loan. The previous loans helped Srey Ra to improve her living conditions. Now, she is leading her group in taking out this new Kiva loan. She will use this loan to buy cement and sand to build ground gutters for other people to generate income. Srey Ra hopes that this loan will help her to grow her current business.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to build ground gutters for other people to generate more income

loans.name: Loleta

texts.en:
Loleta is 49 years old and married with six children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Loleta needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gumboots and a spade.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. Loleta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 22 years old and single with no children. She makes and sells 'elei' printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for four years. Elei comprises traditional decorative methods used to embellish tapa design. 

Noel joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services. She has now requested a loan to buy rolls of material, rubber designs, wooden designs, a cutter, fabric paint and new stencils. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy rolls of material, rubber designs, wooden designs, a cutter, fabric paint and new stencils

loans.name: Alatupe

texts.en:
Alatupe is 34 years old and married with four children. For the past four years, she has had a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. 

Alatupe has been a member of SPBD since 2011. She now needs a loan to buy insecticide, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. Alatupe will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose

loans.name: Pura

texts.en:
This is Pura from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. She is 54 years old, single, and carries many responsibilities for her siblings, nephews and nieces. She extends financial assistance to them regularly. They are the reason for her perseverance, as she doesn’t want to work for herself alone. She runs a “sari-sari” or variety store that sells usual commodities like eggs, bread, repacked condiments, toiletries, and many more. She also cooks rice cakes and includes it in her variety store inventory for additional income. 

Her income provides for her everyday needs and financial assistance for her relatives. She knows that the competition is stiff and profits are irregular, hence Pura dreams of expanding her business. She needs additional supplies in her variety store, so as to meet the demands of customers who prefer to buy from a store with wide selections. She knocks at your kind hearts for a loan assistance of PHP 10,000 which she can use as additional capital for her enterprise. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her variety store.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 55 years old and divorced with one child. She runs a florist business and has been doing this for more than five years. 

Louise needs a loan to buy fertilizer, plastic pots, galvanized pots, iron vases, insect sprays, a watering hose and plastic bags. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. Louise will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, plastic pots, galvanized pots, iron vases, insect sprays, a watering hose and plastic bags.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia, 35, is engaged in a “sari-sari,” or variety store business, in her community in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. She sells various commodities that are essential to everyday living for the people in her area. These include sachets of shampoo, toothpaste, soap, snacks, candies, bread, repacked condiments and many other items. 

Antonia earns enough to provide for some of her family's basic needs but there are times that it’s not sufficient. Thus she also ventured into "load retailing" or "electronic load for cellphones." It is also a viable business because most cellphone owners use prepaid plans and only a few subscribe to postpaid plans. In a prepaid arrangement, a person can budget his or her load usage by buying a load valued at ten pesos. 

Antonia and her husband, Orlando, who is also a vendor, work diligently to raise their children well. They are not content to just make a daily living because they aspire to save more for the future. 

With this forward-looking mindset, Antonia wants to make her business more profitable. She would like to take a loan amounting to PhP 15,000 to buy more dry goods and grocery items for her store. She will also set aside some money for her e-loading business. She is hoping that additional income from this loan will not only sustain their everyday needs, but will also boost her savings for their children’s education. Someday she wants to see her business grow into a big grocery store. She draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods and grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Celma

texts.en:
“Sari-sari” or a variety store, appeals to customers if it has a wide selection. This is the reason that Celma wants to take a  PhP 12,000 loan to buy supplies like grocery items and dry goods. These additional stocks will enhance the competitiveness of her store within her community in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. If her sari-sari grows into a big grocery store, according to her plan, its income can sufficiently meet their basic needs and children's school expenses who are studying in college. She is lovingly supported by her husband, Rey, a driver. They both work diligently to enrich their lives and prepare for the future.
 
Celma meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies like grocery items and dry goods.

loans.name: Silomiga

texts.en:
Silomiga is a 37-year-old married woman with six children. For the past four years, she has run a small canteen in her community to earn a living. 

Silomiga has been a member of SPBD since 2011. She now needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler and soft drinks

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, 66, is married to Roberto, a retired worker. They live in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo near their grown up children. Myrna still operates a “sari-sari” or variety store to support and maintain her and her husband’s daily household needs. She also aims to save some amount in case of emergencies, because she has no medical benefits and insurances as a self-employed worker. 

In her store, Myrna sells dry and packaged commodities, with almost all of her products being essential household items and food. She buys these goods at wholesale prices, and then sells them by the piece to her neighbors and the local community. This type of store is very common in the Philippines, and expectedly the competition is stiff. Myrna tries to compete and she wants to enhance it further. 

She is applying for a PHP 12,000 loan, which she will use to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, sachets and packs of toiletries, and many others. This will make her business more stable and she will be able to increase her income. She will be very grateful if you can extend your generosity to her.

All CCT community clients such as Myrna are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans, and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Mujeres Tejedoras Group

texts.es:
Belvina (la tercera de izquierda a derecha)  es una mujer de 33 años de edad, es soltera y vive en una comunidad  denominada Santa Catarina Palopó, ella para poder obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gatos de la casa se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica de su región, ella tiene  tres años de realizar esta labor, para Belvina seguir superándose es muy importante, es por ello que desde hace algún tiempo ha tenido la iniciativa de mejorar sus negocio, pero esto no le ha sido posible, por tal razón junto a un grupo de señoras solicita un préstamo para compra de artículos de (bisutería) para elaborar artículos de artesanías y llamar la atención de los turistas que visitan su comunidad diariamente.
El gran sueño de esta humilde mujer es comprar un terreno para construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Belvina (third from left to right) is a 33 year old woman. She is single and lives in a community called Santa Catarina Palopó. In order to earn income and help her parents with the household expenses she works buying and selling clothing typical of her region. She has been doing this work for three years.

Continuing to outperform herself is very important to Belvina which is why some time ago she took the initiative to improve her business, but has not been able to. It’s for this reason, together with a group of women, she is asking for a loan in order to buy some costume jewelry items in order to make craft items drawing the attention of tourists who visit their community daily.

This humble woman’s big dream is to buy land to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Even at her age of 63, Linda doesn’t want to stop working yet. She feels productive when she earns money by herself. She doesn’t want to depend on her grown-up children because they have their own families to raise and support. 

She enjoys selling ready-to-wear clothes such as school uniforms, skirts, blouses, and other items. The income derived from her business sustains her and her husband’s daily needs. Her 65-year-old husband, Alejandro, is already retired. He takes a turn in watching over her store located at Barotac Viejo Public Market in Iloilo. 

Linda normally experiences stiff competition in business, but she focuses on her goal to be productive and continue earning a living. It fuels her to expand her business by making it more enticing to customers. She plans to buy more up-to-date clothes and add sweaters or jackets in time for the rainy season. She needs additional capital of PhP 20,000 to buy these items so she can gain extra profit and savings in case of emergencies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more up-to-date clothes and add sweaters or jackets to her inventory.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alfa is a 20-year-old woman who lives in the town of Chikomba West, Zimbabwe. Alfa is an aspiring entrepreneur running a home-based hair salon. She started this business when she finished school. She acquired training and experience from working in her friend’s hair salon, but she wanted to be financially independent as a woman and be in a better position to empower other young women like her. She has successfully run the business and would love to expand it. She inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur and a devoted carer for the elderly. 

Alfa’s business has been doing considerably well. She has been able to make her repayments on time and she has earned respect from her peers. She have also diversified into selling groceries. She feels this will enable her to earn more profits and to supply groceries to people within their community.  She desires to get a second loan so that she expands her grocery business. Thank you for supporting Alfa’s business!

loans.use: To purchase groceries for resale

loans.name: Kay

texts.en:
“Ukay-ukay” is a coined term from the Filipino word “hukay” or “dig” in English. It refers to the hot business in the Philippines nowadays – the selling of used clothes. Yes, used clothes are being sold in the Philippines, but these are of course in good condition and are usually branded.  It’s quite in demand due to its low, low prices. At the onset of this business, used clothes were literally piled on top of a table or floor and customers would dig deep to get their choice clothes. It has leveled up these days and clothes are already arranged on hangers. 

Kay chose to venture in this kind of business. She operates a store of used clothes at the public market of Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. She offers jeans, slack pants, shorts, shirts, blouses, and household items like bed sheets, blankets and comforters. Now she would like to add more selections of hot items to entice the buyers. She needs PHP 20,000 additional capital to procure boxes of used clothes. She hopes you are willing to help her, so she can increase her profits, sustain her family’s daily needs, and boost her savings. 

Kay is married to John Herbert and they have three children. Her husband helps her in her ukay-ukay business. They both work hard to provide for the completion of their children’s education. They also want to finish the construction of their house soon. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to procure boxes of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maulupe

texts.en: Maulupe is 20 years old and single with one child. She makes and sells "elei" fabrics to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. Maulupe has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, rubber designs and cutters. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, rubber designs and cutters.

loans.name: Indri

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Indri, one of Ruma’s agents. Indri lives in Klaten, a regency in Central Java province in Indonesia (its capital is the city of the same name). She is happily married. Together with her husband, she has one cute son. Indri sells mobile airtime credits for her community. She just joined Ruma this year and knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to her stall. Moreover, her community sees her as a trusted, friendly and informative mobile provider.

As the business grows, Indri is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Your loan will be very useful in helping Indri improve her business and accordingly, her community which needs access to such services. 

Indri is the one in the photo. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication service by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Tommi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Tommi, one of Ruma’s agents. Tommi is a young man who lives in Klaten, a regency in Central Java province in Indonesia (its capital is the city of the same name). He owns a stall where he sells mobile airtime credits, cheap mobile phones and mobile phone accessories to his community. Even though he is still young, he has a big spirit to become entrepreneur and wants to work hard. Moreover, his community sees him as a kind, trusted and friendly mobile airtime provider.

As the business grows, Tommi needs additional working capital and hopes to take a loan from Kiva lenders. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Tommi's goal in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for lower communities called Mapan. Tommi is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to help community members who need access to communication services.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a married man, aged 28 years. He lives in a rural area with his wife, and they have three children who are attending school. He deals in agriculture, specifically growing fruits such as passion fruits, watermelon and pineapples, and he supplements his family income with a mini retail shop that he runs at his home. He works six days a week, and each day he works for nine hours.

He started his business in 2008 with the aim of earning income to support his homestead, including the extended family, being the major breadwinner. He has acquired this loan in order to buy fertilizers for the pineapples and watermelon garden in order to increase their yields and production.

His clients are traders from surrounding towns, and his dream is to be the leading producer of pineapples, but his biggest challenges are lack of enough capital, unpredictable weather changes and low prices for agricultural products.

He describes himself as a hardworking man. HE apapreciiates the financial boost and partnership.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and pesticides for his plantation

loans.name: Yaya

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Yaya, one of Ruma's agents. Yaya lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about five hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only daughter. 

Yaya owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits to the communities in his village. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to contribute more to the people in his community who need access to such services. Furthermore, his community trusts him and sees him as a good and kind mobile airtime provider.

As the business grows, Yaya needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Yaya’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so that later on his community can access better products with lower prices. 

Yaya is the one you see in this photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credits for members of his village community.

loans.name: Darul

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Darul, one of Ruma’s agents. Darul is a young man who lives in Kendal, a regency in the northern part of Central Java province in Indonesia, west of Semarang. He owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories for his community. Even though he is still young, he has a big spirit to become an entrepreneur. 
 
As the business grows, Darul seeks a working capital loan from Kiva lenders. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his village community. In the near future, Darul wants to serve an e-commerce business for his community. The product is called Mapan, so later on, his village community can have access to buy great products with lower prices.

Darul is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his village community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap, water, biscuits and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Concepcion Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes, de 24 años de edad, está casada, su esposo trabaja en el cuerpo de agentes municipales y es madre de 2 hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad. 

Lourdes, se dedica trabajar en la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol desde hace 8 años, ella trabaja en esta actividad desde que se casó y su esposo no podía estar pendiente de la gente que le ayudaba a trabajar, fue por eso que ella tomo la decisión de estar pendiente de ellos y el lugar donde trabaja está a 12 minutos de su casa. 

Lourdes, necesita el crédito para pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde cultiva y para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas y mano de obra para realizar las diferentes actividades. 

El sueño de Concepción, es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, porque el techo está dañado; también quiere poner un pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
24-year old Lourdes is married and has two children aged 8 and 4. Her husband works for the municipality. She has been growing grains such as maize and beans for eight years--since she got married. The place where she works is 12 minutes from her house.

Lourdes now needs a loan to pay for the land she rents and to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and laborers. Her dream is to make repairs to her home because the roof is damaged. She would also like to start a small business.

loans.use: to pay for the land she rents and to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and laborers

loans.name: Surani

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Surani, one of Ruma’s agents. Surani lives in Klaten, a regency in Central Java province in Indonesia (its capital is the city of the same name). She is happily married. Together with her husband, she has two children. Surani sells drinks and mobile airtime credits to her community. She just joined Ruma this year; she knew Ruma from its sales executive that came to her stall. She joined Ruma because she wants to expand her business in technology.

As the business grows, Surani is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Your loan will be very useful in helping Surani improve her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. 

Surani is the one in the photo. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Tita. Tita lives in Sumedang, located about four hour’s drive from Jakarta. She owns a small stall where she sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits to her community. Tita is happily married and, together with her husband, has three children. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to expand her business in technology.

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Tita sees improvements in her business. As the business grows, she is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the loan to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community. Your loan will be very useful in helping Tita improve her business and accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services. 

Tita is the one who is seen in the photo. She is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her local community.

loans.name: Eliab

texts.en:
Eliab is 38 years old and a resident of Nongo in Rakai district. He is married with six children; all attend school.
 
He carries out a business of farming, which he started in 2006. He also has a goat butchery in the same village. He works the seven days of the week and 12 hours per day, and started this business with the aim of improving his daily income.

Eliab wants a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to buy more manure and pay for mulching. Mulching his banana plantation helps the plantation to retain moisture, and therefore, increases the yields. 

He sells to final consumers within his area since his production is still limited. However, his challenges are lack of enough capital to expand the business and competition.

Eliab is a hardworking man who always looks for development.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Agus. He lives in Sumedang, located about four hour’s drive from Jakarta. He owns a small stall where he sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for his community. Agus is happily married and together with his wife, they already have three children. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business in technology.

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Agus sees improvements in his business. As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Agus improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. 

Agus is the one who is seen in the photo. He is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Jorge Ejerico

texts.es: Jorge Ejerico, tiene la edad  de 65 años, está casado, vive con su esposa,  la cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que tenga una buena germinación y de fertilizantes orgánicos que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones de materia orgánica del suelo y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y durante el desarrollo y cosecha, además pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno y de labores que le ayuden a que el agua de lluvia no cause daños por la erosión, y también para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
65-year old Jorge Ejerico is married and lives with his wife who is very important to him. With the loan he wishes to buy high-quality bean seeds which germinate well. He also wishes to buy organic fertilizer which will help him improve the condition of the soil as well as other products to apply to the beans as they grow.

Jorge also needs to pay for laborers to help him prepare the ground, stop rain water causing erosion, apply the fertilizer etc., and work on the crop as it develops. In this way he will be assured of a good harvest. 

He hopes to take advantage of the good climate and soil that the area possesses and also put into practice his many years' experience growing crops like beans. In addition, by buying quality products he hopes that the crop will be healthy and develop well.  

After the expected good harvest, Jorge will use the money he earns for the wellbeing and education of his family. He will fulfill some family goals and continue investing in his land. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he has not received loans from other state banks. FUDECOSUR has offered him easy terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: Buy bean seeds and other supplies

loans.name: Mimin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Mimin. Mimin lives in Sumedang, located about four hour’s drive from Jakarta. She owns a small stall where she sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits for her community. Mimin is happily married and together with her husband, they have one cute daughter. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to expand her business in technology. 

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Mimin sees improvements in her business. As the business grows, she is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the loan to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Mimin improves her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services.
