Avec les bénéfices, elle compte aider son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et s’occuper de ses enfants soins médicaux habillement……)
texts.en:
[This group has been created on July 12, 2008 at the launch of its banc villageois. The group is composed of women living in the same neighborhood. They have a good rapport and a team spirit. They mainly work as vendors.

Ms. Dienaba Gouro (the one seated on the far right raising her hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is 31 years old, married and has three daughters. She cooks food for sale.

With this new loan she plans to buy one bag of sugar at 25,000 West African francs, beans for 25,0000 francs, coffee for 35,000 francs, and three trays of eggs at 9,000 francs for her food stand. These are the supplies she needs every two weeks. Thanks to her revenue, she plans to help her husband with everyday household needs as well as take care of her children's healthcare expenses.

loans.use: to stock up on sugar, beans, coffee and eggs.

loans.name: Mairfa

texts.en:
Mairfa is a 22-year-old single lady, living in Jarash. She is a third-year student in the university majoring in special education. She chose this major because she wants to help those people who have physical disabilities in their life and to support them morally.

She is one of six members so her parents face some financial problems that led Mairfa to apply for an educational loan to help her cover the semester fees. Mairfa's future plan is to find good work so she can help her brothers to complete their education.

She is an example of a lady who has the willpower to help her be a successful lady in the future. She needs your support.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell, so that she will have a greater variety of items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheet metal and nails.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 30 años de edad, es feliz mente casado y viven en unan comunidad de Chichicastenango, para Manuel el bienestar de su familia es lo más importante es por ello que cuenta que gracias al crédito él logro comprar sus materiales para la remodelación de su casa, aunque hasta ahora  aun lo está trabajando, Manuel cuenta también que sin este apoyo él no hubiera empezado la remodelación es por ello que agradece profundamente esta oportunidad, pero Manuel viendo su gran necesidad ahora solicita un nuevo crédito para poder comprar materiales como cemento, cal, arena y hierro para que en este mismo años quede su casa terminada.
El gran anhelo de Manuel es ofrecerle a su querida familia un hogar más seguro y digno.
texts.en:
Manuel is a man of 30 years of age. He is happily married and lives in a community of Chichicastenango. For Manuel, the well-being of his family is the most important thing. It is for this reason that he relates that thanks to the loan, he managed to buy his materials for the remodeling of his house, even though up to now he is still working on it. Manuel also relates that without this support, he would not have begun the remodeling. It is for this reason that he is profoundly grateful for this opportunity. But Manuel, seeing his great need, is now applying for a new loan to be able to buy materials such as cement, lime, sand, and iron so that his house will be finished this same year.

Manuel's great dream is to offer his beloved family a more secure and worthy home.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, lime, sand, and iron

loans.name: Geiner

texts.es: Geiner , tiene la edad  de 22 años, está en unión libre, vive con su hijo y esposa, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol que se adapte bien a las condiciones de la zona y de buena calidad y que tenga una buena germinación y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Geiner is 22 years old and in a common-law marriage. He lives with his son and his wife, who are his first priority.

With his loan, he intends to purchase high-quality bean seeds that adapt well to the area's conditions and that have a good germination. He will also buy fertilizers and other products to apply to the cultivated land, as well as pay for labor to apply the products and tend to the plantation once it develops. In this way he will ensure that he does good work.

He intends to take advantage of the area's good climate and soil conditions for this plant, and to put into practice his years of experience managing basic grains. In addition to being able to buy the best products of the highest quality, so that his plantation can develop well and be healthy, he will have a sufficient harvest and important production in the short term.

With the income of the harvest he expects to have, he wants to spend on the well-being and education of his family, fulfill a few family goals, and continue investing more in the plants.

This is the first loan that he has received from Fudecosur. He has no had any prior loan through state banks, but Fudecosur has provided him the loan with greater ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to sow beans

loans.name: Las Agricultoras De Panimatzalam Group

texts.es:
Josefa es una gran mujer  muy trabajadora, entusiasta de 45 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de los cuales tienen entre 17 y 24 años, ellos viven en una comunidad de panimatzalam Sololá, para Josefa su familia es el más grande regalo que la vid le dio y para cuidarlo y que tengan lo necesario se dedica a la costura de servilletas típicas, ella lleva 30 años de ejercer esta humilde labor, Josefa como toda la gente de su pueblo siembran por cuerdas milpa que al final de año produce en grandes cantidades mazorca de maíz y con ello se alimentan durante todo el año, ellos ahora han sembrado unas cuerdas de maíz por lo que necesitan de sus fertilizante para darle el mantenimiento, pero Josefa no cuenta con dinero necesario para poder comprarlos por tal razón  solicita un crédito junto a un grupo de personas para cubrir esta necesidad.
El gran sueño de Josefa es poder comprar un terreno para aumentar  el patrimonio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Josefa is a great woman who is very hard-working and enthusiastic at the age of 45. She is married and has a beautiful family of four children between the ages of 17 and 24. They live in a community of Panimatzalam, Sololá. For Josefa, her family is the greatest gift that life has given her. To care for them and so that they have the necessities, she works sewing traditional napkins. She has done this humble work for 30 years. 

Josefa, like all the people of her town, plants plots of land that at the end of the year produce great quantities of ears of corn, and with this they are fed through all the year. They have now planted some plots of corn for which they need fertilizer in order to maintain them, but Josefa doesn't have the necessary money to be able to buy it. For that reason, she is applying for a loan along with a group of people in order to cover this necessity.

Josefa's great dream is to be able to buy a plot of land to increase the inheritance of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Amig Chaco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIG CHACO” iniciará el décimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de pan, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de ropa, venta de detergentes, venta de mochilas.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa deportiva; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa deportiva por mayor) de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz para posteriormente comercializarlo en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y  el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Amig Chaco" will begin its sixteenth cycle in "Pro Mujer", as part of the Collpani Regional Hub. It is made of nine members, and is lead by a board where Juana is the Secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry on are varied. Among them are: food sales, neighborhood store, bread sales, sportswear sales, clothing sales, detergent sales, and backpack sales. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small micro-entrepreneurs of which Juana is a member. She tells that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Now, she has a business selling sportswear. She states that she learned that business from her sister several years ago.

The loan that she is taking out is to increase capital, for the purchase of wholesale sportswear from the wholesale salespeople in the city of La Paz. Later, she will sell the clothing in the outdoor markets in the city of El Alto. This form of work lets her generate resources to help her family financially, since she is married and has five children.

When you ask Juana what she likes about "Pro Mujer", she replies that she likes the training and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: with the purchase of wholesale sportswear.

loans.name: Suldan Group

texts.en: Sahra was born in the town of  Gabiley in 1975 and she is 40 years old. Sahra has 9 children and she is the head of her household. Sahra is a businesswomen who has a small shop in Gabiley. She started her business in 2002 and her shop has been getting better year after year. However, to expand her small shop, Sahra requests a loan of $500 from Kaaba MFI to buy sugar, rice, flour, biscuits, drinks, etc. Sahra is the leader of the Suldan Group, which consists of six female members. Sahra is the one sitting in the middle of the photo and raising her hand. All group members have separate existing small businesses. Kaaba will provide goods as loans to Suldan Group members and then they will make monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour, biscuits, drinks, etc., for her  shop.

loans.name: Rosas De Bautista Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE BAUTISTA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maxima es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de alfombras, venta de mantas, venta de chalecos, venta de masitas, venta de ropa, venta de comida, tienda de barrio.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maxima es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de su tía que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá hace cinco años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “ROSAS DE BAUTISTA” will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. It is made up of eight members, and is governed by a board of directors, of which Maxima is the president. The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses, some of which include: a corner store, and the sale of carpets, blankets, vests, pastries, clothing, and food.

The loan they take out will benefit small micro-businesses, where Maxima is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer by the invitation of her aunt, who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling blankets. She wants others to know that she learned this business from her mother five years ago.

The loan Maxima will take out now is for increasing capital to purchase wholesale wool, which she will acquire from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto. Later, once completed, she will sell it at El Alto’s fairs. This form of work allows Maxima to generate resources to support her family economically, given that she is married.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Maxima says she likes the health facilities and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale wool.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Not only Givi but his family also greatly gives thanks for the first Kiva loan that Givi managed to receive. Thanks to that loan his business really developed. 

Now Givi hopes that he will manage to have one more pleasant Kiva partnership. For more than seven years, Givi has been in the business of auto mechanics. He manages his work in his own garage, and his brother greatly helps him. His clients are already his regular customers who greatly trust him, and they know that Givi will do his work very properly and with convenient prices. 

Givi’s father takes orders of floor grinding and in this way helps his sons to cover their family needs. Givi‘s mother is sick, and all the family does its best to care for her properly. 

Givi would like to be supported by the Kiva lenders one more time as he needs money for repairing and painting a damaged car which he will resell with a profitable price and some more income for his family.

loans.use: to repair and paint the damaged car which he will resell at a profitable price for some more income for his family

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 59 years old and married with one child of adult age. She has been a wholesaler of various fruits like bananas, apples and others in her city for almost 20 years. From this long time experience of selling, she already has high knowledge in dealing in this kind of business. 

Even though there are many competitors in the city, Celsa still gets more customers above the rest due to her good salesmanship and characteristic effort. She has been successful over the years and manages to save more money for her family. 

For now, Celsa is planning to buy a parcel of land in order for her to manage a new business which is creating a small pigpen for additional income in the near future. To fund this project, she needs additional capital to purchase varieties of fruits like bananas, apples, watermelon and others for wholesale, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of fruits like bananas, apples, watermelon and others for wholesale

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a new client to UGAFODE Microfinance. He is married with two children, and one is attending school. Kenneth does a boda boda (motorcycle taxi) as his major source of income, a job he has done for over two years. 

Kenneth decided to save some money to buy his own motorcycle since he has been riding somebody else's. Therefore, he decided to join UGAFODE where he opened an account and saved some money on which he applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to top up and buy his own motorcycle to earn more income to meet all his family's financial needs. 

Kenneth thanks UGAFODE for the assistance which has enabled him to own a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Sulimoni

texts.en:
Sulimoni is 35 years old with one child. She runs a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. 

Sulimoni requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel and chemicals to assist her to run the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2014, and she will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel and chemicals

loans.name: Fuifui

texts.en:
Fuifui is a Samoan citizen. She is 29 years old with six children and runs a business of selling fish in the village and at the market to earn a living. 

Fuifui requested a loan to buy fishing net, fishing gear, a container, an ice bag and a torch to help her run the business. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2014. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, fishing gear, a container, an ice bag and a torch

loans.name: Jose Steeven

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo vive José y su esposa, dos jóvenes muy trabajadores.
José hace años atrás trabajó en un bodega de arroz como despachador, con esos ingresos él pudo ir ahorrando y actualmente con el apoyo de su esposa cuenta con negocio propio. Su negocio lleva apenas 2 meses, está muy bien ubicado junto al mercado, ellos se dedican a la venta de arroz y azúcar, comenta que le ha ido muy bien en este poco tiempo, tienen varios clientes ya que tanto él como su esposa tienen carisma para vender.

Es un joven emprendedor, ninguna institución le dio la mano cuando quiso iniciar su negocio, ahora está feliz porque con el crédito de Fundación Alternativa y del proyecto Kiva podrán fortalecerlo e incrementar en productos como aceite y papel higiénico que son productos de consumo masivo. Así mejoraran sus ingresos y podrán ir surtiendo poco a poco

Están muy agradecidos con KIVA por permitir que jóvenes trabajadores puedan cumplir sus sueños de contar con su negocio propio y salir adelante.
texts.en:
In the city of Santo Domingo live José and his wife, two very hardworking young people.

For years, José worked in a rice warehouse as a deliveryman. With this income he was able to save, and currently, with the support of his wife, he has his own business. His business is barely two months old, and it is very well located near the market. They work selling rice and sugar. He says it has gone very well in this short time. They have several customers, since both he and his wife have charisma to sell.

He is an enterprising young man. No institution gave him a hand when he wanted to start his business. Now he is happy because with the loan from Fundación Alternativa and the Kiva project, they will be able to strengthen the business and add products such as oil and toilet paper, which are products of mass consumption. In this way they will improve their income and be able to supply little by little.

They are very grateful to Kiva for allowing hardworking young people to achieve their dreams of having their own business and getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy goods for mass consumption.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
Marcos, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta 5º grado, se dedica a manejar un microbús de san Jorge a su comunidad, esta acompaño, es padre de un hijo,  y por eso marcos trabaja muy duro para que no les falte el sustento diario a su familia.

Marco, lleva cuatro años dedicándose al manejo de un microbús, esa es su principal fuente de ingresos,pero él los  quiere mejorar  con la crianza de pollos, de los cuales la encargada  de cuidarlos será su pareja, y así mejorar la economía de su familia.

El crédito será invertido en la compra de pollos de engorde,  el concentrado  y las vacunas para para darles una buena alimentación.

Marcos, sueña con que el negocio de pollos crezca, para así mejorar su calidad de vida, aumentar sus ingresos y asegurar el futuro de du hijo.
texts.en:
Marcos is 21 years old and went to school until the 5th grade. He drives a minibus in San Jorge, his community. He has a common-law-wife and a son. For this reason, Marcos works hard so that his family doesn't lack daily sustenance. 

Marcos has been driving a minibus for four years. This is his main source of income but he wants to improve his income by raising chickens which his wife will take care of. This will allow them to improve the family's finances. 

This loan will be used to buy broiler chickens, concentrated feed and vaccines to provide the chickens good nutrition. Marcos dreams that his chicken business will grow so that he can improve his quality of life, increase his income and secure his son's future.

loans.use: to buy broiler chickens and concentrated feed.

loans.name: 21 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “21 DE SEPTIEMBRE” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Otilia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de zapatos, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de frazadas, servicio de instalación a gas.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Otilia es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de una amiga hace siete años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz y fideo por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las Vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz, y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  la capacitación y las reuniones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The group bank "21 of September" will begin its tenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada bank group. This group is composed of 8 members and is directed by a board of directors, of which Otilia is President. The businesses of these borrowers are varied. They include milk sales, shoe sales, neighborhood store, food sales, blanket sales and gas system installation. The loan they will receive will support these small entrepreneurs, including Otilia. 
Otilia says that she has been a part of Pro Mujer for ten years. She joined at the invitation of a friend, who is also a client with the institution. Today, Otilia has a business selling food. She learned this business from a friend seven years ago. The loan she requests now will be used to increase her capital (to purchase rice and pasta in bulk). She will purchase these items from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz. Then she will prepare them and sell them from her stall.
She is married and has two children, and this work enables Otilia to earn money to support her family economically. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Otilia responds that she enjoys the trainings as well as the meetings which are offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase rice and pasta in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her university fees.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 22 years old and comes from Burundi. He was accepted by Kepler from over 6,000 applicants, showing his motivation and ability through his high school results, standardized testing and a personal interview. He plans to major in Business and Communications and will graduate Kepler with an AA and a BA from an accredited US university. 

Francis will be the first in his family to attend college. He has three younger brothers.   He says he likes to work hard, and is proud that he is honest in everything he does. In his spare time, he likes to produce music.

After Kepler, he wants to start his own business. He believes doing this will enable him to help his brothers, and his community in general. He thinks at Kepler he will use his team spirit on teams and learn more about entrepreneurship.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Titing

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Titing. Titing lives in Sumedang, located about a four hour drive from Jakarta. She owns a small stall where she sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits for her community. Titing is happily married and together with her husband, they have two cute daughters. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to expand her business in technology, as well as give more contribution to her community.

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Titing sees improvements in her business. As the business grows, she is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the loan to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Titing improve her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. Titing is the one who is seen in the photo. She is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Ezechiel

texts.en:
Ezechiel is 23 years old and comes from Burundi.  He will be a Business and Communications student at Kepler in Kigali, Rwanda.  He was accepted by Kepler from over 6,000 applicants, showing his motivation and ability through his high school results, standardized testing and a personal interview. He plans to major in Business and Communications and will graduate Kepler with an AA and a BA from an accredited US university. 

Ezechiel says his activities after Kepler will be related to creating jobs and fighting against poverty and hunger. He is passionate about helping small children who are living in roads. Specifically, he hopes to start a new business in farming. 

He is first in his family to attend college.   A cousin helped with accommodation and food in order to continue with the second part of the secondary school. He has six brothers and wants to help them with their education.  He likes debates and working hard.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Chanelle

texts.en:
Chanelle is 19 years old and comes from Burundi.   She was accepted by Kepler from over 6,000 applicants, showing her motivation and ability through her high school results, standardized testing and a personal interview. 

Chanelle chose to attend Kepler to increase her knowledge and to reach her goal of helping society. She will graduate Kepler with an AA and a BA in business or health management from an accredited US university. 

Chanelle says she adapts quickly easily understands others.  She has three brothers and two sisters. 

She will be the first in her family to attend college. She hopes after Kepler to begin her own social program and perhaps to pursue a masters degree.  She believes she will develop new professional skills at Kepler that will help her with her career.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Ally

texts.en:
Ally is 24 years old and comes from Burundi, where higher education opportunities are very limited.  He was accepted by Kepler from over 6,000 applicants, showing his motivation and ability through his high school results, standardized testing and a personal interview. He plans to major in Business and Communications and will graduate Kepler with an AA and a BA from an accredited US university. 

He believes whatever career her pursues, he must help his community.  Although Ally works hard and attended a strict school, he says he likes to joke and make his friends laugh. He thinks college will help him work in groups better. 

Ally will be proud to be the first in his family to attain a degree from the US.  He was raised both in Burundi and due to conflict, Nairobi.  He lived with his father, who is a tailor.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Olivier

texts.en:
Olivier is 28 years old and comes from Burundi.  He was accepted by Kepler from over 6,000 applicants, showing his motivation and ability through his high school results, standardized testing and a personal interview. He plans to major in Business and Communications and will graduate Kepler with an AA and a BA from an accredited US university. 

Olivier says he plans to run a business with a mission to help the children and teenagers to aspire for leadership and becoming history makers. He believes at Kepler he will earn enough skills and competencies to be an effective social entrepreneur.  

Olivier is both first in his family to attend college.  He has four younger sisters still in high school.  He likes true stories movies all films that have inspirational messages. 

Olivier says that he believes every human being is unique and has capacity to do amazing things. He values each and everyone’s input or understanding of things and trusts that we can make a better world.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Kusminto

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Kusminto. Kusminto lives in Kudus, located at east of Semarang, the capital of Central Java, 9 hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Kusminto is happily married and together with his wife, they have two children (one daughter and one son). As a main source of income, they own and manage a small wedding make-up and photography business. Right now, Kusminto also sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He learned about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall and he decided to join Ruma because he is interested in Ruma’s system; the sales executive will be coming to his stall to collect the money.

As the business grows, Kusminto is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits for his communities. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Kusminto improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Kusminto is the one who appears in his own stall. He will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: This loan of $600.00 will be offered to Jose to send his daughter, Berta, to university. He is very supportive of his daughter because he hopes his daughter will have a brighter future. He will use the loan to pay for registration fees and all school materials. Jose loves his daughter very much and he hopes his daughter's future will be successful. His daughter is not in this photo because she is in school in another capital.

loans.use: to pay registration fees and all school materials

loans.name: Autasia

texts.en: Autasia is 31 years old with four children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. Autasia requested a loan to buy banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals to assist her to run the business. She joined SPBD in 2014, and she will expand her business using her profit.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Vaoita

texts.en: Vaoita is a 66-year-old mother with six children and has a small business selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) to earn a living. Vaoita requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her to run the business. She will expand her business using her profit and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Upuia

texts.en: Upuia is a 38-year-old mother with four children. She runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Upuia requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedling), banana tube (seedling), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and water tank to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedling), banana tube (seedling), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and water tank

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose lives in Oecusse and he is a teacher. He loves his daughter very much and he wants his daughter to be successful. So he is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to send his daughter, Elvira, to university. He will use this loan to pay for registration and school materials.  His daughter is not in this photo because she is in school in the capital.

loans.use: to pay for registration and school materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy metal sheeting and nails to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en: Delfina lives in Liquisa. She is married and she is a businesswoman. She has been doing business since 2014 with her own working capital of $800. She is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital to buy additional supplies to keep in her store such as soy sauce, cooking oils, cigarettes, sardines, balls, milk, eggs, noodles, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve her management of the business.

loans.use: to buy soy sauce, cooking oils, cigarettes, sardines, balls, milk, eggs, noodles, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Merlin

texts.es: Merlin es un joven de 33 años muy  emprendedor que se dedica al cultivo de café y maíz desde hace cinco años. Vive en la comunidad de Yamaranguila en Honduras junto  a su madre la cual está bajo su cuidado, su meta a corto plazo es formar su propia familia, por lo cual el desea tener mejores condiciones de vida ya que donde el reside actualmente no cuentan con servicio de energía eléctrica debido a esto el esta solicitando financiamiento con Soluz Honduras para la compra de un Sistema Solar el cual le permitirá tener acceso a una mejor fuente de iluminación y será de gran provecho en sus labores diarias.
texts.en: Merlin, 33, is very enterprising and for the past five years has been growing coffee and corn.  He lives in the community of Yamaranguila in Honduras with his mother who is in his care.  His short-term goal is to establish his own family, so he strives for better living conditions.  The area where he lives now does not have electricity, so he is requesting financing through Soluz Honduras to buy a solar energy system.  This will provide better lighting which will help him in his daily chores.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy system for his home.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es:
Ana, de 41 años de edad, está casada, estudio hasta sexto grado y tiene dos hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.

Ana, se dedica a dos tipos de negocio, a la sastrería y tiene una tienda, tiene 24 años de haber aprendido acerca de la sastrería y su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.


Ella necesita el crédito para surtir la tienda y comprar material para la sastrería como hilos, telas, botones y zíperes. 


Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ana, 41, has a sixth grade education.  She is married and has two dependent children.

She runs two businesses, a tailor shop and a store.  She learned sewing 24 years ago and her work schedule is from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Ana is in need of a loan to stock her store and to buy sewing materials such as thread, fabrics, buttons and zippers.

Her dream is for her children to get an education and to become professionals.

loans.use: To stock her store and buy sewing supplies such as thread, fabrics, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 62 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 19 y 33 años, esta familia viven en una comunidad de Panimache Primero, para Miguel el trabajo de día es una bendición porque lo hace con único fin de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, él tiene 3 años de trabajar como jornalero. Miguel  por vivir en una de las comunidades más lejas hasta ahora no cuenta con agua potable en casa y tienen que cargar agua desde varios kilómetros, por tal motivo la gente se ha organizado para llevar a sus casas agua potable, y don Miguel forma parte de este proyecto pero el en este momento, ya no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder pagar a la gente y así pueda gozar de este beneficio.
El gran sueño de Miguel es poder construirles una casa a sus hijos y que vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Miguel is 62 years old, married and has a lovely family of four children of ages between 19 and 33 years old. The family lives in a community in Panimache Primera. For Miguel, work is a blessing because he does it in order to earn an income and support his family. Miguel has been a labourer for three years. 

Owing to the fact that he lives in a remote community, Miguel does not have running water at home and has to carry water for a number of kilometres. As a result, locals have come together to have running water at their homes. Miguel is part of this project but does not currently have enough money to pay people and take advantage of the benefits of this project.

Miguel's big dream is to be able to build a house for his children and that they might live better.

loans.use: to have running water.

loans.name: Hacia El Mar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HACIA EL MAR” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Luz es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de pescado, venta de abarrotes, venta de ropa, venta de productos nutricionales.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Luz es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer  por la invitación de un asesor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos nutricionales; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tónicos por mayor) que adquirirá de la empresa central ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz para posteriormente, comercializarlo en las ferias de la cuidad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "HACIA EL MAR" is beginning its second Pro Mujer loan cycle through the Cascada social center.  The group consists of ten members and its management team is led by Luz, the president.  The members are involved in different businesses including vegetable sales, food sales, a convenience store, fish sales, a grocery store, clothing sales and nutritional products sales.

The loan they are seeking will benefit small business owners including Luz.  She joined Pro Mujer by invitation through a representative of the institution.  Her current business is selling health products which she learned about on her own several years ago.

The loan is for her to increase her work capital to buy wholesale tonics from a company in the city of La Paz.  She will sell tham at fairs in the city of El Alto. Through her work she is able to generate an income to support her family economically.  She lives with her common-law husband and three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says it is the training provided by the institution.

loans.use: To buy nutritional tonics, wholesale.

loans.name: Elizita

texts.en: Elizita is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as milk, toothpaste, gambling cards, biscuits, sugar, candy, soft drinks and other things to sell. Elizita started to open her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $600. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin to her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy milk, toothpaste, gambling cards, biscuits, sugar, candy, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is requesting a loan of $700 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store including lighters, tea, milk, cooking oils, noodles, biscuits, eggs, shampoo and other things to sell. She has been doing business since 2014 with her own working capital of $300. She is taking this loan to improve her business and the management of her business because she wants to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: to buy lighters, tea, milk, cooking oils, noodles, biscuits, eggs, shampoo and other things to sell.

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
María, de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, tiene dos hijos que viven en E.E.U.U. y solo vive con su esposo y un nieto.

María, tiene venta de comida y de antojitos como yuca, enredos y pasteles desde hace 15 años de edad.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar granos básicos como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas. 

Ella sueña con que sus nietos se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
María, who is 55 years old, studied as far as sixth grade. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She has two children who live in the US and she just lives with her husband and a grandson.

María has been selling food and snacks such as cassava, enredos [a traditional snack of fried cassava strands] and pasteles [typical fried cornflour-based pasties filled with meat and vegetables] since she was 15 years old.

She needs the loan to buy basic grains as well as manure, pesticides and herbicides.

Her dream is for her grandchildren to have an education.

loans.use: to buy basic grains as well as manure, pesticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en: Gabriela lives in Liquisa and her business is making paun (bread). She has been involved in business activities since 2012. She started with her own working capital of $300. She is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is very interested in her business, so she will take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more materials such as cooking oils, wheat, sugar, salt and other things to use. She needs the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve the management of her business and she wants to increase her future income.

loans.use: To buy cooking oils, wheat, sugar, salt and other things to use.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is 32, married to a housewife and has one daughter. He has a small fattening project and works in farming. Khaled is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy a bred cow to increase his milk, butter and cheese sales and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a bred cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, de 47 años de edad,  estudio hasta el tercer grado de educación básica, vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura. 

Teresa, tiene un negocio de venta de pupusas, en el cual lleva un año, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de tortillas, negocio en el cual llevaba más de 6 años, decidió emprender su negocio para ayudar a la economía familiar ya que la situación esta difícil, y con este negocio está contribuyendo bastante para su hogar, la venta de pupusas la realiza todas las tardes a fuera de su casa y en esta su pareja le ayuda con la atención a los clientes.  

El Crédito será utilizado  para la reparación de la casita donde vende las pupusas, además de comprar mesas y sillas para atender a sus clientes,  ya podrá tener un local donde sus clientes se podrán protegerlos del sol y la lluvia. 

El sueño de Teresa es preparar a sus hijos académicamente, para que sean personas de bien para la sociedad, también quiere mejorar su negocio, y que este siga creciendo para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa, 47 years old, studied until 3rd grade of elementary school. She lives with her partner and her two children, who are studying. Her partner works in farming.

Teresa owns a business selling pupusas, which she has been running for one year. Before, she sold tortillas for more than 6 years. She decided to open the business in order to support her family financially, given that they are in a difficult situation. The business is contributing significantly to the household. She sells pupusas every afternoon outside her house. Her partner helps her by attending to customers.

The loan will be used to repair the small house where she is selling pupusas, as well as to buy tables and chairs for the customers. This way, Teresa will have a small restaurant where her customers will be protected from the sun and the rain.

Teresa's dream is for her children to succeed academically, so that they will become good people who contribute to society. She also wants to improve and grow her business  in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair a small house, and to buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana is in agriculture and she sells the local produce. She is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her business. She will use this loan to buy more local produce in other places and after she buys, she will bring the produce to the market for resale. She started to sell vegetables in 2000 with her own working capital of $50. Now she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to use it to buy more vegetables such as papaya, corn, bananas and other things. Everyday her life is selling local produce because she is earning a good income from it.

loans.use: to buy papaya, corn, bananas and other things.

loans.name: Teresinha

texts.en:
Teresinha lives in Liquisa and most of her daily income is from her kiosk. She is now applying for a loan of $1,000. She will use the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies for her kiosk such as biscuits, hand and body cream, sauce, soy sauce, candy, tea, soft and hard drinks and other items. 

She started to do this business in 2013 with her own working capital of $600. She is happy with the loan that was offered to her, because she can improve her business.

loans.use: To buy biscuits, hand and body cream, sauce, soy sauce, candy, tea, soft and hard drinks and other items to sell.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta lives in Liquisa and most of her daily income is from selling cows. She is now applying for a loan of $600. 

Jacinta started her business in 2013 with her own working capital of $500. With her husband, she was going to add money to their principal amount to buy another cow, and to improve their business, because it has become their activity. 

She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more cows in the future.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Santa Teresita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTA TERESITA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de prendas de vestir, venta de mantas, venta de comida, venta de abarrotes, venta de cosméticos, venta de muebles, servicio de fotocopiadora, venta de joyas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rita es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su cuñada desde hace varios años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “SANTA TERESITA” communal bank is beginning its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada. It is made up of eight members and is managed by a board of directors where señora Rita is President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank work in are varied, including: clothes sales, blanket sales, food sales, groceries sales, cosmetic sales, furniture sales, photocopying services and jewellery sales.

The loan they will receive will benefit small micro businesses where señora Rita is a member. She explains that she joined Pro Mujer after the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a food sales business; she says that she learned this business from her sister-in-law several years ago.

The loan she will receive now is for increasing capital (buying potatoes and rice in bulk) which she will acquire from the wholesalers in El Alto city and later, after production, sell in her stall. This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family economically, as she is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health services offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria  es una mujer de 25 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos y productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio. 
Ella es emprendedora, optimista, atenta, comprometida con su trabajo, sociable, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por una intensa actividad económica que generó el asentamiento de los mercados más grandes de innumerables galerías y locales comerciales. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Maria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello corto crespo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y en el comercio mayormente habla español. Su vida la realiza con sus familiares que trabajan viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; leche, jugos, pan, azúcar fideo, arroz, refrescos, galletas, productos de limpieza, etc., en su tienda de barrio, que por causa de falta de comercio en el área no cuenta con competencia directa. Su labor la realiza de forma independiente todos los días de la semana en horario del día, “con mi negocio pagamos parte de los gastos familiares, quiero abastecerlo para poder vender más…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia directa, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer el negocio constantemente. Su sueño es tener su casa propia, ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra por mayor de abarrotes y artículos de primera necesidad para la venta en su tienda, ya que no existe competencia directa. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes y artículos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda y con los beneficios pagar parte de los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Maria is 25 years old and is single with no children. She has a business selling groceries and basic essentials in her neighbourhood shop. She is enterprising, optimistic, attentive, committed to her work, sociable, friendly, responsible and very hard-working. She runs her business in the southern part of the city, an area characterised by intense economic activity which arose from the establishment of the largest markets with numerous arcades and commercial outlets. The area has a warm sub-tropical climate with a temperature which varies from 21 to 35 degrees Centigrade during the day. 

María has a dark complexion, brown eyes and short curly hair and is short in stature and physically robust. Her mother tongue is Guaraní which is spoken locally and for business she mainly speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her family members who are working and they live in a rented house built of brick and cement with a corrugated metal roof and cement floor. It has running water, electricity and sewerage. Her business is selling groceries and basic necessities such as milk, juices, bread, sugar, noodles, rice, soft drinks, biscuits, cleaning products etc. in her neighbourhood shop. Because there aren't many businesses in the area she has no direct competition. She carries out her work independently every day of the week with regular daily hours. "With my business we pay part of the family's expenses. I want to stock up so I can sell more..." she says. The advantage of her business is that it has no direct competition while the disadvantage is the lack of capital to constantly stock the business. 

Her dream is to have a house of her own. She wants to expand her business by buying groceries and basic essentials wholesale to sell in her shop, as there is no direct competition.

These are the reasons why María is asking for a loan to buy groceries and basic essentials to stock her shop and with the profits pay part of the family's expenses. This is her first loan cycle in the year which she has been working in this business.

loans.use: to buy groceries and basic essentials to stock her shop and pay part of the family expenses with the profits.

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en:
Natalina wanted to complete  her house, but the money she had was not enough to buy the materials to complete the house. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to complete her house. 

She is taking this loan because  she wants to buy more materials such as cement, sand, iron, nails, wood, ceramics, doors, windows and other materials to use. She is very happy with the loan that Tuba Rai Metin offered her, because with this loan she can complete her house.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, iron, nails, wood and other materials to use.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en: Carlito is 26 years old, he is working in the office of agriculture and he supports his younger sister, Selfiana. A loan of $800 will allow Carlito to send his younger sister, Selfiana, to secondary school. He will use the loan to pay for monthly expenses, building fees, clothing, shoes and school supplies. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to help his younger sister have a brighter future. His younger sister is not in this photo because she is in school in the capital.

loans.use: To pay for monthly expenses, building fees, clothing, shoes and school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase energy-saving stoves and solar lights at wholesale price.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is 48, married and has 5 children. He takes care of his parents who live with him in the same house. 

He is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy a breeding cow to get more milk. His mother and wife will use the milk to make cheese and butter to sell in the market.

loans.use: To buy a breeding cow.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en: Alita is applying for a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a second hand clothes shop. She started this business in 2014 with her own working capital of $500. She sells her clothes at home, but on market day she also brings her clothes to sell in the market. Alita is earning a good income from selling her second clothes because many people like to buy them, they are cheap and unique compared to new clothes.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shorts, shirts, skirts, long-sleeved shirts, short-sleeved shirts and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marvin Yobany

texts.es: Marvin, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. Desde hace 10 años se ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando café, maíz y frijol. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Está solicitando el tercer ciclo de prestamo en la institución con el actual que es por 20,000 lempiras, con este prestamo va comprar abono, fertilizantes y para limpieza de su finca de café y poder sacar mejor producción. Su meta es comprar un terreno para tener ganando de engorde, y piensa en mejorar su casa para darle bienestar a su familia.
texts.en: Marvin is 33 years old, and cohabits with his wife, with whom he has two children. He resides in a village of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. For 10 years, he has worked in agriculture growing coffee, maize, and bean. This produce she sells in the local market. He is asking for the third cycle of loans with the institution, which is for 20,000 lempiras. With this loan, he will buy manure, fertilizer, and the cleaning of his coffee farm and be able to have more production. His goal is to buy a plot of land to have livestock for fattening, and he wants to improve his house to give more well-being to his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, and for the cleaning of his coffee farm.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including biscuits, detergents, cooking oils, sardines, nuts, coffee, soft drinks and hard drinks, and other things to sell. She has been doing business since 2009 with her own working capital of $500. She has a kiosk and she wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan as good management practice to improve her business. She is happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin, which will allow her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy biscuits, detergents, cooking oils, sardines, nuts, coffee, soft drinks and hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima has been involved in business activity since 2010, with her own working capital of $800. Most of her daily income is from selling pigs. She is happy in her business because she makes a good income from selling pigs. She is now applying for a loan of $700. With her husband, she is going to add money to their principal amount to buy more pigs, which has become their business activity. She is happy with the loan that was offered to her by Tuba Rai Metin because in the future she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is married and she has three children. She became involved in business activities a few years ago. She started with her own working capital of $400. Ana is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business. She sells gasoline because she earns a good income from this business, and she lives near the main road. Every day many people come to buy her gasoline, so she is happy with her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more gasoline.

loans.use: To buy gasoline.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Mrs Thanh is 49 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for six years.

Thanh lives in Yen Dinh, a rural district in Thanh Hoa province in Vietnam. Her family is a low-income household in a village. Moreover, market demand is low in this region. She has no collateral, so she can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that her lartrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

In 2015, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thanh has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Thuyết

texts.en:
Mrs Thuyết is 47 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for six years.
 
Thuyết lives in Yen Dinh, a rural district in Thanh Hoa province in Vietnam. Her family is a low-income household in a village. Moreover, market demand is low in this region. She has no collateral, so she can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that her lartrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

In 2015, Thuyết joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thanh has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mrs Mai is 47 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for six years.
 
Mai lives in Yen Dinh, a rural district in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in a village; moreover the market need is low in this region. She has no collateral and can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that her lartrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

In 2015, Mai joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Mai has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, iron and sand.

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en:
Mrs Hiền is 34 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for six years.

Hiền lives in Thieu Hoa, a  rural district in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in a village. Market demand is low in this region. She has no collateral and can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that her lartrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipments to build a toilet.

In 2015, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Alefa

texts.en:
Alefa is a 42-year-old married woman with 4 children. 

She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Alefa needs a loan to buy bags of flour and sugar, cooking oil, yeast, etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. 

Alefa has been a member of SPBD since June 2015. She joined in order to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour and sugar, cooking oil, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Rotorua

texts.en:
Rotorua is 30 years old and married with 3 children. 

She runs a small business selling banana chips in her community, and she has been doing this for 3 years. 

Rotorua has requested a loan to buy oil, frying pans, paper, bananas, a gas oven, etc. She joined SPBD in June 2015 to gain access to capital. 

Rotorua will use her earnings and profit to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy oil, frying pans, paper, bananas, a gas oven, etc.

loans.name: Mile

texts.en:
Mile is 40 years old and married with 2 children. 

She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, tomatoes, cucumber, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Mile has requested a loan to buy bush knives, chemicals, weedkiller, a wheel barrow, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. 

With her profits, Mile hopes to improve her business and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, chemicals, weedkiller, a wheel barrow, etc.

loans.name: Karanjung Indah Group

texts.en:
The members of Karanjung Indah group made their loan payment on July 9, 2015. All members attended the meeting and they made the payment one by one to MUK’s Field Officer. On that day, the group also decided to continue their loan with the same loan size and no changes in the composition of the group.

Ni Komang made her payment after she sold her three fattened pigs. She sold them one month before the due date. Each pig can reach a weight of 80 kg and she sold all for 6,000,000 IDR. She still has one pig left in the cage. After deducting the loan payment, feed and medicines, Ni Komang earned a net profit 1,900,000 IDR for six months. This income supported her family’s needs.

Feeling the benefits of  this business, the Karanjung Indah group are continuing their loan. They still need capital to support and increase their pig population. Ni Komang used her portion of the loan to purchase superior piglets only. She bought feed and medicines with her own money. To reduce the cost, Ni Komang still uses the traditional feed, which she combines with a superior feed. Her experiences from the training she had from MUK make sure she can manage the pigs well. Her dream is to renovate her house from the profits of the pig business. Now she will save all the profits to make her dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets.

loans.name: Mekar Jadi Pondoan Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut, head of the Mekar Jadi Pondoan Group, is responsible for the repayment to MUK. 

Ni Ketut sold all of her fattening pigs which she had been feeding for 6 months. She was very pleased with the profit she made. This was all because of MUK, Kiva and its lenders. She sends her thanks for the support that she has had. She has saved the profit, after deductions for repayments to MUK, for future needs.

The Mekar Jadi Pondoan Group are requesting another loan. The loan in this period will still be used to support their efforts in breeding pigs. Now Ni Ketut has a sow and many piglets. Next week is a Hinduism holiday, so currently the price of piglets is very expensive at 500,000 IDR per piglet. She will use her part of the loan to purchase superior feed and to renovate the pens. 

Ni Ketut and the members of Mekar Jadi Pondoan hope that their efforts will be supported, and that they can become independent in the future so that they will no longer need to borrow money.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed and to renovate the pens

loans.name: Atonio

texts.en:
Atonio is a 26-year-old man who is single with no children. 

He runs a business sewing and selling clothes in his community, and he has 12 years of experience with this business. 

Atonio has requested a loan to buy material, needles, threads, a sewing machine, etc. He plans to use his profits to expand his business. He joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, needles, threads, a sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба жительница городка Душанбе. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем и воспитывает троих детей. Из-за финансового положения семьи Махбуба решила найти работу и зарабатывать. Но без высшего образования она не нашла работу, но не растерялась. Она решила открыть свой бизнес и работать на себя. Махбуба сначала купила несколько коробок фруктов и вышла на базар торговать и поняла что у нее есть талант продавца и ее товар покупают. И теперь Махбуба спешит за кредитом, чтобы купить еще больше фруктов и овощей и продолжить только что начатый бизнес. Поддержите Махбубу в ее начинаниях.
texts.en: Mahbuba is a resident of the city of Dushanbe. She is 35 years old. She is married and is raising three children. Mahbuba has decided to find work and earn money due to the family's financial position. Without a higher education she has not found work, but she has not lost her head. She has decided to open her own business and work for herself. Mahbuba initially bought a few boxes of fruit and went to the market to trade, and she has found out that she has talent as a salesperson and people are buying her goods. And now Mahbuba is hurrying for a loan in order to buy more fruit and vegetables and continue her recently-started business. Please support Mahbuba in her endeavors.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Merryanne

texts.en:
Merryanne is a 23-year-old single woman with no children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro, banana and copra (dried coconut meat) to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

She has requested a loan to buy bush knives, chemicals, weedkiller, a wheelbarrow, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. 

With her profits, Merryanne hopes to expand her business and to save to buy a vehicle to help her with her business.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, chemicals, weedkiller, a wheelbarrow, etc.

loans.name: Agabek

texts.ru: Агабек жительница района Джиликул. Ей 62 лет, она замужем и любимая мать, и бабушка для своих детей и внуков. Вот уже 30 лет как она занимается растениеводством. Она очень любит трудиться. Агабек очень радуется, когда её дети довольны её трудом. Она всегда помогает им во всем, не смотря на свой преклонный возраст. Её муж тоже вместе с ней занимается растениеводством. На своем участке она посадила рис и хочет купить минеральные удобрения для того чтобы обработать землю и получит хороший урожай. У Агабек не достаточно денег и по этой причине она хочет, взят кредит. Агабек очень надеется на Вашу поддержку и верит, что в старости лет вы ей поможете.
texts.en: Agabek is a resident of the Jilikul region. She is 62 years old, married, and a beloved mother and grandmother to her children and grandchildren. She has been growing crops for 30 years. She really likes to work. Agabek is very glad when her children are happy with her work. She always helps them with everything despite her advanced age. Her husband also grows crops together with her. She has planted rice on her plot of land and wants to buy mineral fertilizer to treat the soil and get a good harvest. Agabek does not have enough money and so she wants to take out a loan. Agabek really hopes for your support and believes that you will help her in her old age.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: На фотографии запечатлена Гулнора. Ей 41 год. Она с детства отличалась своей ответственностью и серьезному подходу к каждой работе. Гулнора вышла замуж и родила двоих прекрасных детей. Ее муж уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Он не забывает о своих родных и помогает им финансово. Гулнора занимается животноводством. Основным источников дохода в семью приносит бизнес Гулноры Этот бизнес она продвигает уже 7-ой год. Гулнора обратилась за поддержкой, чтобы расширить животноводческую деятельность. Сейчас у нее 2 коровы и она собирается купить еще пару телят. Гулнора знает, что сделала правильный выбор, обращаясь за кредитом, и надеется, что ее поддержат.
texts.en: This photograph depicts Gulnora. She is 41 years old. She has always distinguished herself since childhood by her responsibility and serious attitude to any work. Gulnora got married and gave birth to two wonderful children. Her husband has gone away to earn money in the Russian Federation. He does not forget his family and helps them financially. Gulnora rears animals. Gulnora's business brings the family its main source of income. She is running this business for its seventh year. Gulnora has applied for support in expanding her animal rearing activities. Now she has two cows and she is going to buy another couple of calves. Gulnora knows that she has made the right choice in applying for a loan, and hopes that she will be supported.

loans.use: to buy a couple of calves.

loans.name: Ahliniso

texts.ru: Эту скромную и талантливую девушку зовут Ахлинисо. Она жительница замечательного района Джиликул. Ахлинисо всегда старается успеть сделать все дела по дому и одновременно шить женские платья. Эта деятельность очень важна для неё, так как она зарабатывает этим на жизнь. Без этой работы она и её семья не в состоянии прожить. Жизненные условия Ахлинисо не так хороши. Ей приходится трудиться, чтобы зарабатывать себе на хлеб. Сейчас она хочет расширить свой бизнес и купить новую машинку для создания вышивки на тканях. С этой машинкой она  сможет шить более красивые платья для своих клиенток. Ахлинисо очень нуждается в Вашей поддержке и великодушии.
texts.en: This modest and talented young lady is called Ahliniso. She is a resident of the wonderful Jilikul region. Ahliniso always strives to manage to do everything around the house and simultaneously to sew women's dresses. This activity is very important for her since she earns a living from it. Without this work she and her family are not able to survive. Ahliniso's living conditions are not so good. She must work to earn her bread. Now she wants to expand her business and buy a new sewing machine to embroider fabric. With this sewing machine she will be able to sew more beautiful dresses for her clients. Ahliniso really needs your support and generosity.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery sewing machine.

loans.name: Claudia Alejandra

texts.es:
Claudia, de 28 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su pareja es agricultor en pequeño y tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad. 

Claudia, es ama de casa, pero también es miembro del comité de su comunidad desde hace más de dos años, en donde realiza las funciones de secretaria. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes y herbicidas para los cultivos que siembra su esposo, ya que de ahí proviene parte de los granos básicos que consume su familia.

Claudia, sueña con seguir cultivando y darle a su hijo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta donde él quiera llegar.
texts.en:
Claudia is 28 years old, studied until high school, and is married. Her partner is a small-scale farmer and she has a 5 year old son. Claudia, is a homemaker, but also has been a member of her community committee for over two years, where she performs the functions of secretary.

She needs the loan to buy fertilizers and herbicides for the crops her husband plants, as they are part of the basic grains that her family eats.

Claudia dreams of continuing to farm and giving her son educational opportunities until he gets where he wants.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for crops.

loans.name: Nurguzel

texts.ru: Нургузел из района Вахдат 29 лет. Она замечательная мать одного ребенка. Её муж работает трактористом. Сама Нургузел преподает в средней школе своего района. Она хорошая учительница. Её ученики получают хорошие знания, а их родители очень ценят Нургузел. Одновременно Нургузел занимается растениеводством. У нее 10 лет опыта в этой сфере. К сожалению одной её зарплаты в школе не достаточно и она планирует расширить свою деятельность. Для этого Нургузел необходимо купить семена разных овощей и минеральных удобрений. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. Нургузел рассчитывает на вашу помощь.
texts.en: Nurguzel is 29 years old and from the Vakhdat region. She is a wonderful mother to one child. Her husband works as a tractor driver. Nurguzel herself teaches in a local secondary school. She is a good teacher. Her pupils receive good knowledge, and their parents really value Nurguzel. At the same time, Nurguzel grows crops. She has ten years of experience in this field. Unfortunately just her school salary is not enough and she plans to expand her business. For this Nurguzel needs to buy various vegetable seeds and mineral fertilizer. She has therefore applied for a loan. Nurguzel is counting on your help.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
Rosa, de 38 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, estudió hasta séptimo grado, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos de los cuales uno ya trabaja en una ganadería cercana y también hace viajes en un camión que le pertenece a Rosa.

Rosa, por el momento se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ella acompaña a su hijo en los viajes que hace con el camión, pero además también se encarga de cuidar y alimentar a unos cerdos que tiene ubicado en el patio de su casa.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar un cafetín que le está vendiendo una amiga, porque ya no quiere tenerlo porque necesita el dinero que gastó en la inversión de la construcción del cafetín junto con sus electrodomésticos.

Rosa, sueña con que sus hijos se superen y lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa, who is 38 years old, is a hard-working woman. She studied until the seventh grade, she is a single mother, and she has two children, one of which is already working in a nearby cattle ranch, and he also drives a bus that belongs to Rosa. 

At the moment, Rosa works as a housekeeper. She goes with her son on his bus rides, but she is also in charge of taking care and feeding some pigs that she has in her backyard.
